dataLists.description: Data List definition for this message.

order.description: A uniquely identified record of the agreement of one party with another to receive products and services under specified terms and conditions. Order supports the sale of a flexible range of airline products and services that are not necessarily Journey based (e.g. subscription services). Comment: A 'PNR', 'super PNR' and 'ticket' are all today's versions of airline implementations of aspects of an Order. An Order may support non-homogeneity, i.e. each passenger in an Order may hold different sets of order items at different prices.

processing.description: A set of Information related to how response results should be returned.

promotionList.description: Information related to publicizing a product, organization, or venture so as to increase sales or public awareness.

ticketDocInfo.description: Information corresponding to a group of 1 to 4 Tickets for a single Origin Destination and a single Passenger.

warning.description: Contains information related to potential business errors detected during processing of the preceding request.

paymentFunctions.description: Information related to the settlement of a transaction through monetary or other compensations. For example, a payment may be applied to an entire Order or individual Order Items.

distributionChain.description: An instance of a distribution channel. That is, the set of organizations involved in the development of the current transaction.

OrderForfeitedInfoType.title: Air Order Forfeited Info Type
OrderForfeitedInfoType.description: Information related to an amount which could not be recovered as a consequence of a servicing operation.

orderItemRefID.description: Reference to an Order Item ID for which may be forfeited.

paxRefID.description: Reference to a Pax ID within this message.

price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

PaymentFunctionsOrderType.title: Air Payment Functions Order Type
PaymentFunctionsOrderType.description: Is the container of all payment relevant functions.

orderAssociation.description: Reference to an Order or Order Items for which this payment method applies.

orderPaymentSummaryAllocation.description: Reference to an Order or Order Items for which this payment method applies.

paymentProcessingSummary.description: Information relating to a payment transaction including payment status.

paymentSupportedMethod.description: Contains information relating to payment method acceptance. This always relates to the airlines payment acceptance terms regardless of preference expressed by a seller using PaymentCriteria.

WeightAllowanceType.title: Air Weight Allowance Type
WeightAllowanceType.description: Baggage weight allowance with application information.

maximumWeightMeasure.description: Maximum weight value and unit of measure. Example: 50

minimumWeightMeasure.description: Minimum weight value and unit of measure. Example: 50

totalMaximumWeightMeasure.description: Stores the maximum weight for all the combined pieces within this baggage allowance.

weightUnitOfMeasurement.description: The unit of measurement of weight defined as imperial or metric.

CommissionType.title: Air Commission Type
CommissionType.description: An amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.

amount.description: Commission amount and currency code. Example: 20 USD

percentageAppliedToAmount.description: The amount to which the percentage will be applied. For Example: Net Amount Gross Amoun Difference between the Net and Gross amounts.

taxableInd.description: When TRUE, the commission amount specified is subject to Tax/VAT.

PayerAuthenticationFailureToCompleteCode.title: Air Payer Authentication Failure To Complete Code Content Type
PayerAuthenticationFailureToCompleteCode.description: Lists reason for failure to complete payer authentication.

DifferentialTypeCodeType.title: Air Differential Type Code Content Type

baggageDisclosure.description: Disclosure information specifically related to baggage.

SeatType.title: Air Seat Type
SeatType.description: A sitting place for a passenger or crew in a cabin compartment on a transport vehicle.

columnID.description: Alphabetic character identifying a seat within a row.

rowNumber.description: Ordinal number identifying a seat row in an aircraft.

seatCharacteristicCode.description: Characteristic of an aircraft seat e.g. A (Aisle seat), E (Exit and emergency exit),..., according to PADIS code list 9825.

seatProfileRefID.description: Reference to a Seat Profile ID within this message.

PaymentSupportedMethodType.title: Air Payment Supported Method Type
PaymentSupportedMethodType.description: Contains information relating to payment method acceptance. This always relates to the airlines payment acceptance terms regardless of preference expressed by a seller using PaymentCriteria.

clearanceMethods.description: These are the clearance options with their supporting information proposed by the carrier for a given offer. It supplies the methods available to clear a payment. It is part of the 'Payment Supported Method', and it is relevant whenever the method of payment will require clearance of funds between the partners of the sale. Includes the Commission data to allow the carrier to support choices that are in line with its payment policy.

paymentBrandCode.description: A Payment Brand code assigned according to ATS Codeset PAYB. Example VI for Visa

paymentMethodCountryCode.description: The country in which the payment method was issued or created. Fir example: 'US' for a card issued in the United States or 'AU' for an e-wallet account created in Australia.

paymentRedirectionInd.description: Indicates that an Airline will capture payment via a separate hosted payment platform, e.g. via a URI generated by an airline's payment platform

paymentSurcharge.description: Information about surcharges for payment methods.

paymentTypeCode.description: A Payment Type code assigned according to ATS Codeset PAYT. For example: 'CC' for Customer Card.

SecurePaymentVersion2Type.title: Air Secure Payment Version2 Type
SecurePaymentVersion2Type.description: Contains all information for the result of 3D-Secure authentication process. Applicable to 3DS v2.0 and higher.

cardNumberCollectionCode.description: Indicates the collection method of the card number. This will be newly entered or using previously saved information. This is supported by a enumerated list.

payerAuthenticationExemptionCode.description: Used to identify an exemption to performing payer authentication. An enumeration includes the types of exemption.

payerAuthenticationFailureToCompleteCode.description: Used to identify possible pre defined reasons for failure to complete payer authentication.

trxStatusText.description: outcome of authentication - see EMVCO documentation

ConcurOrderViewAugmentationPointRs.title: Air Concur Order View Augmentation Point Rs

callbackConfig.description: Config for a HTTP POST callback with the for a request, to associate/correlate this response to a specific request.

primaryContentSource.description: Source of the content. Example Sabre Adapter, Amadeus Adapter, NDC Hub etc.

secondaryContentSource.description: Source of the content. Example NDC, EDIFACT(ATP), TF, AA, UAD.

canceledFlightSegments.description: Canceled Flight Segments on the trip

processingInfo.description: Indicates the features available for the content in the payload.

RefundType.title: Air Refund Type
RefundType.description: Contains refund type, payment type and amount attributes for a specific product, purpose, or service.

descText.description: Description. Example: 'Full refund within 30 days of departure'.

fixedAmount.description: Stores an exact fixed fee amount relating to this condition.

levelTypeCode.description: This will identify the type of re fundability for the condition. This will be one of the following. Fully Refundable Partly Refundable Non Refundable

maximumAmount.description: Stores an Maximum refund amount which will be applied when a variable fee amount is effective.

minimumAmount.description: Stores an Minimum refund amount which will be applied when a variable refund amount is effective.

paymentTypeCode.description: This stores a code to represent the form of payment to be used to reimburse the customer/passenger.

percent.description: Stores a percentage which will be used to determine the refund to be applied in conjunction or not with minimum and maximum amounts.

DimensionAllowanceType.title: Air Dimension Allowance Type
DimensionAllowanceType.description: Baggage dimension allowance with application information.

heightMeasure.description: The height of the bag defined in either imperial or metric.

lengthMeasure.description: The length of the bag defined in either imperial or metric.

lengthUnitOfMeasurement.description: The unit of measurement of the bag defined as imperial or metric.

linearMeasure.description: Maximum dimensions value. Example: 62 Notes: Linear measurement = length + width + height

widthMeasure.description: The width of the bag defined in either imperial or metric.

BookingInstructionsType.title: Air Booking Instructions Type
BookingInstructionsType.description: Optional service booking instructions to include SSR, OSI and upgrade Method.

methodText.description: PNR booking method. Example: AE (BY SSR - SPECIAL SERVICE REQUEST) For maximum interoperability, refer to IATA PADIS Code List for data element 9750. Select a code value or enter a value that is bilaterally agreed upon between trading partners.

osiText.description: Other service information (OSI) text. Example: PAX VIP MEMBER OF PARLIAMENT

upgradeMethodCode.description: Upgrade method. Example: AE (BY SSR - SPECIAL SERVICE REQUEST) For maximum interoperability, refer to IATA PADIS Code List for data element 9750. Select a code value or enter a value that is bilaterally agreed upon between trading partners.

upgradeNewClassCode.description: New Cabin Type Code related to the Upgrade Method. As defined by PADIS codeset (e.g. 1, 2, 3, etc.)

CabinTypeListType.title: Air Cabin Type List Type
CabinTypeListType.description: List of Cabin Types Technical object only

cabinType.description: Type of compartment of an aircraft, offering specific services (e.g. business class, economy). Business Identifier Fields: - Cabin Type Code

CancelRestrictionsType.title: Air Cancel Restrictions Type
CancelRestrictionsType.description: These are a set of qualifying conditions/rules/restrictions that are related to a constrained priced grouping of services for the Cancellation action.

allowedModificationInd.description: Flags if cancellation is allowed used in conjunction with defined date ranges.

descText.description: Describes what this restriction is. E.G -Cancellation allowed within dates(1) specified with no fee. -Cancellation allowed within dates(2) specified with fee. -Cancellation not allowed

effectiveDateTime.description: This identifies the effective date used in conjunction with the Expiration date to qualify the applicability of this condition This date is relative to the first flight segment.

expirationDateTime.description: This identifies the Expiration date used in conjunction with the Effective date to qualify the applicability of this condition This date is relative to the first flight segment.

fee.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

journeyStageCode.description: Valid Stage Codes are defined in the Journey Stage Type Code ENUM PRIOR TO DEPARTURE NO SHOW AFTER DEPARTURE This will be used either in addition to other BBIE's or individually to qualify a condition.

paxRefID.description: Used to store a ref to the passenger.

refund.description: Contains refund type, payment type and amount attributes for a specific product, purpose, or service.

PostalAddressType.title: Air Postal Address Type
PostalAddressType.description: Natural or physical address used for postal service. May be a building address, airport address, etc.

buildingRoomText.description: Additional address information including building name, room, apartment, or suite number.

cityName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the city, town or village.

contactTypeText.description: PADIS code list: Contact Type (to identify the technical contact type information)

countryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

countryName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the country.

countrySubDivisionName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the sub-division of a country.

poBoxCode.description: Post office box. Example: P.O. Box 21

streetText.description: Street name and number. Examples: Main Street, 100 Main Street

maximumQty.description: The MAXIMUM Quantity of the Option that may be ordered. Example: 4

minimumQty.description: The MINIMUM Quantity of the Option that may be ordered. Example: 2

PricingParameterType.title: Air Pricing Parameter Type
PricingParameterType.description: Pricing Parameters, including Simple Pricing, Award Travel, Auto Exchange, Override Currency and Tax Exemption.

autoExchInd.description: When TRUE, this request is to be handled by an auto-exchange process.

awardIncludedInd.description: When TRUE, award eligible offers to be returned in addition to priced offers.

awardOnlyInd.description: When TRUE, only award eligible offers are requested.

includeUpsellOffersInd.description: An indicator to advise the Airline that the Seller has a preference on receiving upsell offers or not.

overrideCurCode.description: When TRUE, override Currency Code to be returned in addition to priced offers.

simplePricingInd.description: When TRUE, simple pricing is requested for returned offers.

DifferentialFarePriceTypeType.title: Air Differential Fare Price Type Type
DifferentialFarePriceTypeType.description: A differential specialization of an additional specified fare pricing such as 'Net' and 'Filed'. For 'Sell' or public amounts, use the Price in Fare Details.

differentialPrice.description: A specialization of price used for price differentials. Price is the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

farePriceTypeCode.description: Indicates if the fare price provided is a filed amount, net amount, or a sell amount.

datedOperatingLegRef.description: Reference to a Dated Operating Leg within this message

paxSegmentRef.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID . This will be a reference to a single passenger segment that will be defined in a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

BagRuleCodeType.title: Air Bag Rule Code Content Type
BagRuleCodeType.description: Enumeration set for the currency application code Type BDT.

PaxGroupType.title: Air Pax Group Type
PaxGroupType.description: A number of individual passengers traveling under one commercial name that associates them. E.g. a Tour group or a group for sales allotment from airline to agency. Group bookings are subject to special booking rules and may be eligible for special fare rules. Usage and nature of groups is left to bilateral agreements.

contactInfo.description: The electronic or geographic address which a party has provided as the contact channel. For example, contact email, contact postal address, contact phone number.

intendedPaxQty.description: Intended number of passengers for this Group.

AmountType.title: Air Amount Type
AmountType.description: An amount is a number of monetary units specified in a currency.

curCode.description: Currency Code as per ISO 4217 alphabetic code e.g. EUR, USD, AUD

CarrierAircraftTypeType.title: Air Carrier Aircraft Type Type
CarrierAircraftTypeType.description: Carrier defined internal grouping of aircrafts with the same form, function and specification.

carrierAircraftTypeCode.description: Internal code used by an carrier to identify the type of aircraft.

carrierAircraftTypeName.description: Internal name given by the carrier to this aircraft type.

ServiceDefinitionType.title: Air Service Definition Type
ServiceDefinitionType.description: Description and characteristics of a non-flight product or service that can be separately sold and delivered. E.g. bag, seat, meal on a flight. Business Identifier Fields: - [Shopping Response] Shopping Response ID - [Carrier] Airline Designator Code - Service Definition ID

airlineTaxonomy.description: Used in the context of the Airline Taxonomy to define a product or service to the seller or to request a collection of products and services from an airline. For more information on what values should be placed within these fields, see the implementation guide at: https://guides.developer.iata.org

bilateralTimeLimit.description: A bilaterally agreed limitation or restriction of time.

bookingInstructions.description: Optional service booking instructions to include SSR, OSI and upgrade Method.

depositTimeLimitDateTime.description: The date by which a deposit must be paid for an order Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

namingTimeLimitDateTime.description: The time by which an Order must be completed with individual passenger names. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

ownerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

rfic.description: Reason For Issuance Code Examples: A (Air Transportation) C (Baggage) E (Airport Services) F (Merchandise) G (In-flight Services)

rfisc.description: Reason For Issuance Sub Code. Examples: 0CC (First Checked Bag) 0B1 (In-flight Entertainment) 0BX (Lounge)

serviceCode.description: Airline specific service code which can be associated with the Reason for Issuance Sub Code. Sample implementer encoding: XLEG for Extra Leg Room Seat XBAG for Extra Bag

serviceDefinitionAssociation.description: Service Definition Association Choice to determine if the information of this ServiceDefinition needs to be extended with specific Bag or Seat characteristics or whether the ServiceDefinition is used as a bundle of further ServiceDefinitions.

serviceDefinitionID.description: Uniquely Identifies a Service Definition within the context of one message.

addlDataMeasure.description: Provides additional supporting measurement information in case the Special Service requires it.

qty.description: A quantity is a counted number of non-monetary units, possibly including fractions.

specialServiceCode.description: Code that identifies the special service.

TransportPointType.title: Air Transport Point Type
TransportPointType.description: This is a transport point location.

aircraftScheduledDateTime.description: The Scheduled Date and Time of Arrival of the aircraft at the terminal or departure gate at an airport.

iataLocationCode.description: IATA 3-letter code defining the city or airport code.

stationName.description: Name of the station. E.g. George Bush Intercontinental Airport

aircraftScheduledDateTimeLocal.description: The Local Scheduled Date and Time of Arrival of the aircraft at the terminal or departure gate at an airport.

aircraftScheduledDateTimeUtc.description: The Utc Scheduled Date and Time of Arrival of the aircraft at the terminal or departure gate at an airport.

MeasurementSystemCodeType.title: Air Measurement System Code Content Type
MeasurementSystemCodeType.description: Enumeration set for the measurement system code BDT. {codeListAgencyName}PADIS{/codeListAgencyName}

SecurePaymentAuthenticationInstructionsV.title: Air Secure Payment Authentication Instructions Version1 Type
SecurePaymentAuthenticationInstructionsV.description: Data returned from the Directory Server/ACS containing the PAReq and the ACS URL that enable to cardholder to authenticate. Applicable for 3D Secure Version V 1.0.

authenticationTrxID.description: Unique 3D Secure transaction reference number assigned by Access Control System (ACS). Example: Qzl3WVc1TVpXNW5kR2crUEcxbGMzTmhaMlZK WkQ1UVFWSmxjUzB4TWpnNUSXcKTmprNU5EWThMMjFsYzNOaFoyVkpRDQ4TDAxRVBqd3ZVVEr Note: This is typically required for ACS systems that support Status Query.

merchantData.description: Containing merchant state data that must be returned to the merchant.

payerAuthenticationRequestText.description: The authentication request for the 3-D Secure transaction. When sending the customer's browser to the card issuer's ACS, the system will need to include the PaReq in the HTTPS POST.'+CHAR(13)+''+CHAR(10)+'Example: eJzVWFmzosgSfudXdPQ8Gt1sbkzYRhQ7KCjI/sYOsimgoL/+lp7Tp5c5t2d67tMw8yv/WqiluJXS8WyyVFEQT28qz

redirectionURL.description: 3DS Access Control System URL. Note: This is the URL of the Issuing Bank's ACS, to which the cardholder needs to be re-directed. The browser should simply redirect to this URL. ACS or Access Control Server

terminationURL.description: The URL to which the user will be directed to at the conclusion of 3D secure authentication. Example: http://ba.com/paymentResultSuccess

ParticipatingOrgType.title: Air Participating Org Type
ParticipatingOrgType.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

RedressCaseType.title: Air Redress Case Type
RedressCaseType.description: A person's case of being registered with a country's redress program, which can eliminate watch list misidentification and assist in identity verification.

countryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

programName.description: The name of the redress program (e.g. Secure Flight Program).

TicketDocInfoType.title: Air Ticket Doc Info Type
TicketDocInfoType.description: Information corresponding to a group of 1 to 4 Tickets for a single Origin Destination and a single Passenger.

bookingAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

bookingRef.description: Information related to a booking or reservation.

bookletQty.description: Number of booklets issued for a given ticket/ document set.

carrierFee.description: Carrier imposed fee detail, typically related to booking, ticketing, or servicing.

commission.description: An amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.

endorsementText.description: Endorsement and restriction information applied for this set of ticket / document information.

fareDetail.description: The amount charged by the carrier for the carriage of a passenger and his allowable free baggage.

issueInfo.description: The issuing Carrier and issuing location of a ticket.

originalIssueInfo.description: An Original issuing carrier and issuing location and ticket number.

originDest.description: The Origin and Destination airport/city pair which confines a passenger journey or an aircraft flight. Business Identifier Fields: - [Station] (Origin Station) IATA Location Code - [Station] (Destination Station) IATA Location Code

paymentRefID.description: References a payment transaction within this message.

pricingCountryCode.description: The country code used to identify the country in which the booked itinerary was priced.

pricingDate.description: Booked Itinerary Pricing Date. Example: 2017-01-13 Note: This is the date the booked itinerary was priced.

pricingLocationCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

referencedOrder.description: A uniquely identified record of the agreement of one party with another to receive products and services under specified terms and conditions. Order supports the sale of a flexible range of airline products and services that are not necessarily Journey based (e.g. subscription services). Comment: A 'PNR', 'super PNR' and 'ticket' are all today's versions of airline implementations of aspects of an Order. An Order may support non-homogeneity, i.e. each passenger in an Order may hold different sets of order items at different prices.

servicingAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

ticket.description: The accountable document issued by or on behalf of a carrier which includes notices and the flight and passenger coupons contained therein.

ticketRefIdentification.description: Additional, identifying information used to identify a ticket.

voidPeriodExpirationDateTime.description: Void Period Expiration Date time in UTC

LoyaltyRedemptionType.title: Air Loyalty Redemption Type
LoyaltyRedemptionType.description: A form of payment by which the customer uses a virtual currency of a Loyalty Program Account (such as air miles) in exchange for goods or services.

loyaltyCurAmount.description: The quantity of loyalty units redeemed. Example: 15000

loyaltyProgramAccount.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

ClearanceDataType.title: Air Clearance Data Type
ClearanceDataType.description: set of data, either signed or not, that delivers all that is necessary for a clearance of funds to take place when using the SwO Standard and Process. It supplies the data needed to execute the clearance using the SwO Standard and Process. It is the core data required by the Clearance Manager to process a Clearance. Optionally, it can be agreed by the Clearance Payer and the Clearance Payee of the clearance

clearanceID.description: this is an identifier generated by the party requesting the clearance that uniquely identifies the clearance transaction. It provides the necessary link for financial audit connecting the sale to the financial records. This field is required because no other existing data elements could be used by the financial systems or could provide unique identification. The identifier is globally unique for the settlement by design.

clearancePayeeData.description: Data defining the Clearance Payee and relevant to its operations.

clearancePayeeSignature.description: Method of ensuring data integrity and authenticity of the Clearance Data. Clearance Payee and the Clearance Payer Data will be signed already. If the Clearance Payee Data has been signed then this data structure is for the signature of the counterparty. If Clearance Payer Data has been signed then here is the signature of the entity countersigning the entire Clearance data structure.

clearancePayerData.description: Data defining the Clearance Payer and relevant to its operations.

clearancePayerSignature.description: Method of ensuring data integrity and authenticity of the Clearance Data. Clearance Payee and the Clearance Payer Data will be signed already. If the Clearance Payer Data has been signed then this data structure is for the signature of the counterparty. If Clearance Payee Data has been signed then here is the signature of the entity countersigning the entire Clearance Data structure.

netClearanceAmount.description: The funds to be cleared as a result of the payment commitment, the selected payment method, and the date when the funds must be remitted. It is the amount the Clearance Payer must pay to the Clearance Payee on a given Remittance Date taking into consideration any funds due to the Clearance Payer by the Clearance Payee as a result of the same payment commitment.

paymentCommitmentDateTime.description: Defines the date when the PaymentProcessingSummary, with information about amount and payment method, is accepted by ORA to be sufficient to lead to successful payment. This is the date when the status in the 'Payment Status Code' is set to 'SUCCESSFUL'

processRuleCode.description: defines under what governing rules, process and reporting standard the Clearance Manager processes the clearance. Example: IATAC00 or BLTRL00 or NDCLNK0

remittanceDate.description: The date when the amount in the clearance request that is paid by the Clearance Payer will have to reach the settlement manager's bank account

TravelAgentType.title: Air Travel Agent Type
TravelAgentType.description: A private retailer or public service individual that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

travelAgentID.description: Booking and Servicing Agent information. ID. Example: 98417900. Note: The ID correlates to the specified ID Type.

typeCode.description: Agency/ Agent Identification Type. Example: 706 (IATA agency numeric code) Encoding Scheme: IATA Padis Codeset - List for data element 9893 (Identification Type, coded)

ClearancePayeeType.title: Air Clearance Payee Type
ClearancePayeeType.description: The party receiving funds as a result of a clearance for a claim it has made

carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc

org.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

travelAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

DifferentialFareDetailType.title: Air Differential Fare Detail Type
DifferentialFareDetailType.description: The amount charged by the carrier for the carriage of a passenger and his allowable free baggage.

accountCode.description: Corporate ID used for pricing special fares. Example: 675124

differentialFarePriceType.description: A differential specialization of an additional specified fare pricing such as 'Net' and 'Filed'. For 'Sell' or public amounts, use the Price in Fare Details.

fareCalculationInfo.description: Information related to the calculation of the Fare amount by applying various rules to determine a final fare for an airline ticket.

fareComponent.description: A portion of an itinerary between two consecutive fare construction points. If the journey has only one fare component, the points of origin and destination are the only fare construction points

fareIndCode.description: Fare indicator code. Example: 1 (SYSTEM PRICED WITHOUT MANUAL INTERVENTION) Encoding Scheme: IATA PADIS Code List for data element 5387 - Price Type Qualifier

fareWaiver.description: Validating carrier-assigned fare rule modification or override information.

filedFareInd.description: When TRUE, a component of this fare has been priced using filed fare data. If FALSE, dynamic pricing has been applied.

netReportingCodeText.description: Code indicating if the transaction is subject to a net reporting arrangement.

price.description: A specialization of price used for price differentials. Price is the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

pricingSystemCodeText.description: IATA assigned code identifying the system used to price the itinerary for the document being issued.

statisticalCodeText.description: Code used for domestic or international sales differentiation.

DatedMarketingSegmentListType.title: Air Dated Marketing Segment List Type
DatedMarketingSegmentListType.description: A list of dated marketing segments used in the contained message.

datedMarketingSegment.description: The commercial designation under which a Dated Operating Segment can be booked, either under the operating carrier's designator or that of another carrier (codeshare).

LoyaltyAmountType.title: Air Loyalty Amount Type
LoyaltyAmountType.description: An virtual currency amount of a Loyalty Program Account (is a number of monetary units).

curCode.description: Currency Code as per ISO 4217 alphabetic code e.g. EUR, USD, AUD

BagDisclosureRuleTypeCodeType.title: Air Bag Disclosure Rule Type Code Content Type
BagDisclosureRuleTypeCodeType.description: Enumeration values for Bag Disclosure Rule Type.

PaxType.title: Air Pax Type
PaxType.description: Any person except members of the crew carried or to be carried with the consent of the carrier, on board of any transport vehicle such as aircraft, train, bus, ship. Holds the attributes specific to a one booking, from shopping to fulfillment.

ageMeasure.description: The Age of the Passenger. To be used in NDC Anonymous Shopping requests or when the birthdate (in Individual) is not known.

birthdate.description: The Date of Birth of the Passenger. Intended to be used in NDC Anonymous Shopping requests. Example: 2017-01-13

citizenshipCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

contactInfoRefID.description: Uniquely Identifies a set of Contact Information, within the context of one message.

employer.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

foid.description: Form of identification. Typically used to identify that the passenger is who he says he is. This is the type of FOID as defined in AIRIMP (FF Number, Credit Card Number, etc.).

identityDoc.description: Any document which may be used to identify a person or verify aspects of a person's personal identity. If issued in a small, standard credit card size form, it is usually called an identity card. Some countries issue formal identity documents, while others may require identity verification using informal documents. When the identity document incorporates a person's photograph, it may be called photo ID. In the absence of a formal identity document, a driver's license may be accepted in many countries for identity verification. Most countries accept passports as a form of identification.

individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

loyaltyProgramAccount.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

paxID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger within the context of one message.

paxRefID.description: For use from in-lap passenger instance, to reference the adult passenger with whom they are travelling.

profileConsentInd.description: When TRUE, passenger authorizes the airline to share his/her profile information or send promotional emails.

ptc.description: Type code applying to the Passenger which typically drives pricing (e.g. ADT, CHD, etc).

redressCase.description: A person's case of being registered with a country's redress program, which can eliminate watch list misidentification and assist in identity verification.

residenceCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

ConsequenceOfInactionCodeType.title: Air Consequence Of Inaction Code Content Type

ChangeOrCancelFeeType.title: Air Change Or Cancel Fee Type
ChangeOrCancelFeeType.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

approximateInd.description: When true, this fee is approximate.

baseAmountGuaranteeTimeLimitDateTime.description: The length of time the Base Amount of an offer item is guaranteed. In the absence of the Base Amount guarantee time limit, the Base Amount is not guaranteed. Upon expiry, the Base Amount may no longer be guaranteed and either a new shopping process should begin, or the offer should be repriced resulting in a new Offer. Should the Base Amount guarantee time limit extend beyond Order creation, the remaining length of time persists into the corresponding Order Item. The airline can increase the remaining length of time beyond the original time limit should they wish to. This field should only be used when the Airline indicates that a Price Guarantee is available.

Should the fee guarantee time limit extend beyond Order creation, the remaining length of time persists into the corresponding Order Item. The airline can increase the remaining length of time beyond the original time limit should they wish to. This field should only be used when the Airline indicates that a Price Guarantee is available.

localAmount.description: Fee amount specified in a local currency. Example: 7 CHF

maximumAmount.description: Stores an Maximum fee amount which will be charged when a variable fee amount is effective.

minimumAmount.description: Stores an Minimum fee amount which will be charged when a variable fee amount is effective.

percent.description: Stores a percentage which will be used to determine the Fee to be charged in conjunction or not with minimum and maximum amounts.

refundInd.description: When true, fee amount is refundable.

contactInfo.description: The electronic or geographic address which a party has provided as the contact channel. For example, contact email, contact postal address, contact phone number.

ReceiptPaymentCardType.title: Air Receipt Payment Card Type
ReceiptPaymentCardType.description: A specialization of Payment Card as part of the summary of a processed payment, defined as a device that enables its owner (the cardholder) to make a payment by electronic funds transfer.

cardBrandCode.description: A two-letter code assigned according to IATA Resolution 728. Example: VI for Visa

cardholderAddress.description: Natural or physical address used for postal service. May be a building address, airport address, etc.

cardHolderName.description: Name of credit card holder. Example: JOHN SMITH

cardProductTypeCode.description: Used to specify whether the card is a Consumer (personal) or Commercial (corporate) card.

cardSeqNumber.description: Number displayed on a payment card following the card number which indicates if the card is an original or if it was re-issued with the same card number.

cardTypeText.description: Additional description for the magnetic stripe card type (debit card, credit card, prepaid card, etc.)

expirationDate.description: The last month of validity Example: 0119

maskedCardID.description: Concealed credit card number, Example: xxxxxxxxxxxx9922

paymentInstrumentOwnershipCode.description: Owner of the Payment Instrument. For example, Seller would mean the Seller is using their own card, BSP/ARC etc

protectedCardID.description: Payment card number protected in a non format preserving fashion.

reconciliationID.description: Identifies the individual for this specific transaction when the card is shared (for example, corporate card). This ID is typically used for payment reconciliation. It could be a client reference, cost center or a project number (PO Number)

securePaymentAuthenticationInstructionsV.description: Data returned from the Directory Server/ACS containing the PAReq and the ACS URL that enable to cardholder to authenticate. Applicable for 3D Secure Version V 1.0.
Data returned from the Directory Server/ACS containing the PAReq and the ACS URL that enable the cardholder to authenticate. Applicable for 3D-Secure. Applicable for 3D Secure Version V 2.0.

securePaymentVersion1.description: Contains the indicators and fields that convey the result of the 3D Secure authentication transaction. Applicable for 3D Secure Version V 1.0.

securePaymentVersion2.description: Contains all information for the result of 3D-Secure authentication process. Applicable to 3DS v2.0 and higher.

secureProgram.description: Contains enrolment information of the Payment Card. e.g. Verified by Visa.

tokenizedCardID.description: An identifier corresponding to a set of payment card details, used between merchant and payment card service provider.

SecurePaymentAuthenticationVersionType.title: Air Secure Payment Authentication Version Type
SecurePaymentAuthenticationVersionType.description: Used by Seller if 3D-Secure is supported. Seller can specify which version of 3D-Secure is supported. Note: 3D-Secure context should be used when the Customer-Seller interaction type is web and/or mobile.

cardEnrollmentVersionText.description: The authentication request for the 3-D Secure transaction.

supportedVersionText.description: Version of 3-D secure being used in this payment transaction. Possible values '3DS2'

MeasureType.title: Air Measure Type
MeasureType.description: A measure is a numeric value determined by measuring an object along with the specified unit of measure.

unitCode.description: The type of unit of measure.

DisclosureType.title: Air Disclosure Type
DisclosureType.description: Information which should be made known.

desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

disclosureID.description: Uniquely Identifies a disclosure within the context of one message.

companyId.description: Employer Company UUID of the User.

configId.description: Config UUID to be used for the User.

ruleClassId.description: Rule class UUID to narrow down the Config for a User.

BilateralTimeLimitType.title: Air Bilateral Time Limit Type
BilateralTimeLimitType.description: A bilaterally agreed limitation or restriction of time.

descText.description: Additional text to supplement a specified time limit.

timeLimitDateTime.description: Date and time of the time limit. E.g. 2017-05-30T09:00:00

PaxSegmentRefType.title: Air Pax Segment Ref Type
PaxSegmentRefType.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID . This will be a reference to a single passenger segment that will be defined in a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

PaxSegmentType.title: Air Pax Segment Type
PaxSegmentType.description: Transportation of a passenger on a Dated Operating Segment. - [Dated Marketing Segment] (All identifying fields) - [Order] Order ID - [Individual] (no identifier available)

cabinTypeAssociationChoice.description: A choice of Cabin Type Association to leg(s) or a segment

datedMarketingSegmentRefId.description: A reference to a unique identifier of a dated marketing segment used in a message.

marketingCarrierRBDCode.description: Code used to identify a particular RBD (e.g. P, J, W, M, etc.).

operatingCarrierRBDCode.description: Code used to identify a particular RBD (e.g. P, J, W, M, etc.).

paxSegmentID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger Segment within the context of one message.

settlementInfo.description: Information related to the value of a product or service as it pertains to interline transactions.

AddlNameTypeCodeType.title: Air Addl Name Type Code Content Type
AddlNameTypeCodeType.description: This will include a codelist with defined types of additional names. {codeListAgencyName}IATA AIDM{/codeListAgencyName}

OrderAssociationType.title: Air Order Association Type
OrderAssociationType.description: Reference to an Order or Order Items for which this payment method applies.

orderItemRefID.description: Reference to an Order Item ID for which this payment method applies.

orderRefID.description: Reference to an Order ID for which this payment method applies.

PaymentProcessingSummaryPaymentMethodTyp.title: Air Payment Processing Summary Payment Method Type
PaymentProcessingSummaryPaymentMethodTyp.description: Payment Processing Summary Payment Method is a form of procedure for the payment of goods or services plus any transactional information specific to the payment method other than the amount.

accountableDoc.description: A Form of payment which utilizes a previously issued accountable travel document (ticket, EMD, coupon, etc.) which has an outstanding credit value.

iataEasyPay.description: Specialization for Payment Processing Summary. IATA EasyPay is a payment instrument with a specific remittance mechanism. This FOP is not limited to BSP.

loyaltyRedemption.description: A form of payment by which the customer uses a virtual currency of a Loyalty Program Account (such as air miles) in exchange for goods or services.

offlinePayment.description: Contains instructions from the Airline relating to payment using other payment capabilities 'offline' from EASD data exchange. For example, by use of an airline payment gateway.

paymentCard.description: A specialization of Payment Card as part of the summary of a processed payment, defined as a device that enables its owner (the cardholder) to make a payment by electronic funds transfer.

settlementPlan.description: When related to a Carrier Fee or a Payment Method or a Payment Processing Summary.

voucher.description: A document that entitles the holder to a discount or that may be exchanged for goods or services.

AirlineTaxonomyType.title: Air Airline Taxonomy Type
AirlineTaxonomyType.description: Used in the context of the Airline Taxonomy to define a product or service to the seller or to request a collection of products and services from an airline. For more information on what values should be placed within these fields, see the implementation guide at: https://guides.developer.iata.org

descText.description: To enable the Airline to describe the Taxonomy without the need for the Seller to refer to a specifc Taxonomy optionally.

taxonomyCode.description: Used for defining a product or service within the Shared Industry Taxonomy or bilaterally.

taxonomyFeature.description: Bilaterally agreed mechanism to describe specific product and service information to the Seller as defined by the Airline. This defines a further level of definition for a airline taxonomy code. e.g meal (TC 03F0) -> breakfast(03F1) - eggs(03F2),toast(03F3)

DatedOperatingLegType.title: Air Dated Operating Leg Type
DatedOperatingLegType.description: The nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

airlineTaxonomy.description: Used in the context of the Airline Taxonomy to define a product or service to the seller or to request a collection of products and services from an airline. For more information on what values should be placed within these fields, see the implementation guide at: https://guides.developer.iata.org

arrival.description: This is a transport point location.

carrierAircraftType.description: Carrier defined internal grouping of aircrafts with the same form, function and specification.

changeofGaugeInd.description: When TRUE, indicates a Change of Gauge will take place between the current leg and that which immediately precedes it.

datedOperatingLegID.description: Uniquely identifies a leg within the context of one message.

dep.description: This is a transport point location.

distanceMeasure.description: Total distance between the beginning and end stations of a leg, measured by the great circle of the earth.

iataAircraftType.description: Grouping of aircrafts with the same form, function and specification, currently flown, or soon to be flown. Possible types are defined in the IATA SSIM. The same type may include aircrafts with different technical specifications such as engines, range, cockpit configuration. Business Identifier Fields: - IATA Aircraft Type Code

onGroundDuration.description: Total time the aircraft remains on the Ground between this leg and the leg which immediately precedes it.

richMedia.description: An external resource such as an Image, Video, PDF or other which is available for display

paxJourney.description: A collection of segments which satisfies transportation of a passenger for a given origin and destination. Business Identifier Fields: - (no identifier available)

individualName.description: A Payer individual is a specialisation of the individual type defined as: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

organisationName.description: Payer Organization is a specialization of the organization type defined as: is an organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

ReceiptIATAEasyPayType.title: Air Receipt IATA Easy Pay Type
ReceiptIATAEasyPayType.description: Specialization for Payment Processing Summary. IATA EasyPay is a payment instrument with a specific remittance mechanism. This FOP is not limited to BSP.

iataEasyPayEncryptedData.description: container for the encrypted Easy Pay data

paxSegment.description: Transportation of a passenger on a Dated Operating Segment. - [Dated Marketing Segment] (All identifying fields) - [Order] Order ID - [Individual] (no identifier available)

CollectionPointTaxType.title: Air Collection Point Tax Type
CollectionPointTaxType.description: Tax data breakdown by collection point for XF(Passenger Facility Fee) and ZP(federal tax segment) taxes.

airportAmount.description: Amount filed by the airport in the currency applicable to the geographical location of the airport.

station.description: Location or facility where air or surface transportation originates, stops and/or terminates, and where passengers and/or cargo can be taken on or off. Those of relevance to the airline industry are identified by an IATA Location Identifier (3 letter location identifier). There are also additional airports without an IATA identifier that may be used in disruption scenarios that will be identified by an ICAO 4 letter code (assigned to every registered airport, military or civil). Business Identifier Fields: - IATA Location Code

serviceDefinition.description: Description and characteristics of a non-flight product or service that can be separately sold and delivered. E.g. bag, seat, meal on a flight. Business Identifier Fields: - [Shopping Response] Shopping Response ID - [Carrier] Airline Designator Code - Service Definition ID

DatedOperatingSegmentListType.title: Air Dated Operating Segment List Type
DatedOperatingSegmentListType.description: A list of dated operating segments used in the contained message.

datedOperatingSegment.description: An operation between board point and any subsequent off point within the same flight designator. Could be one or more legs. Could also be used for other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

TravelAgencyType.title: Air Travel Agency Type
TravelAgencyType.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

agencyID.description: Unique Agency Seller ID. Example: CTRV

contactInfo.description: The electronic or geographic address which a party has provided as the contact channel. For example, contact email, contact postal address, contact phone number.

pseudoCityID.description: An identifier for a corporate user of a computer reservation system (CRS) or global distribution system (GDS), typically a travel agency. Also known as Office ID.

travelAgent.description: A private retailer or public service individual that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

typeCode.description: Agency type code. Examples TravelAgency, OnlineTravelAgency, or TravelManagementCompany.

OriginDestType.title: Air Origin Dest Type
OriginDestType.description: The Origin and Destination airport/city pair which confines a passenger journey or an aircraft flight. Business Identifier Fields: - [Station] (Origin Station) IATA Location Code - [Station] (Destination Station) IATA Location Code

destCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

originCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

originDestID.description: Uniquely identifies an Origin Destination within the context of one message.

paxJourneyRefID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger Journey within the context of one message.

CurrentCouponFlightInfoRefType.title: Air Current Coupon Flight Info Ref Type
CurrentCouponFlightInfoRefType.description: Current Coupon Flight Information Latest flight information as it relates to a coupon eg Current CheckedIn Flown.

checkedInAirlinePaxSegmentRef.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID's - 1 or more pax segments references. These references will be to a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

currentAirlinePaxSegmentRef.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID's - 1 or more pax segments references. These references will be to a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

flownAirlinePaxSegmentRef.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID's - 1 or more pax segments references. These references will be to a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

SeatOnLegType.title: Air Seat On Leg Type
SeatOnLegType.description: A sitting place for a passenger or crew in a cabin compartment on a Dated Operating Leg. Business Identifier Fields: - [Dated Operating Leg] (all identifier fields) - [Seat] (all identifier fields)

occupationStatusCode.description: Information related to the availability of a particular Seat on Leg.

seat.description: A sitting place for a passenger or crew in a cabin compartment on a transport vehicle.

PaymentMethodAddlInfoType.title: Air Payment Method Addl Info Type

paymentCardAddlInfo.description: Additional Information relating to Payment Cards. For use with PaymentTypeCode(s) relating to Card forms of payment

paymentOtherMethodAddlInfo.description: Additional Information for other payment criteria. For use with PaymentTypeCode(s) relating to Other forms of payment

rsaKeyValue.description: An RSA (asymmetric encryption algorithm) public key used to encrypt data.

ExcessBaggageType.title: Air Excess Baggage Type
ExcessBaggageType.description: Excess baggage information displayed on a coupon.

excessBaggageMeasure.description: Excess baggage measure and associated Unit of Measurement (e.g. 10 kg).

carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

org.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

travelAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

PayerOrganisationType.title: Air Payer Organisation Type
PayerOrganisationType.description: Payer Organization is a specialization of the organization type defined as: is an organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

LengthUnitCodeType.title: Air Length Unit Code Content Type
LengthUnitCodeType.description: List of Length Unit Codes. Subset of UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20. {codeListAgencyName}AIDM (extract from UN/CEFACT){/codeListAgencyName}

TicketRefIdentificationType.title: Air Ticket Ref Identification Type
TicketRefIdentificationType.description: Additional, identifying information used to identify a ticket.

refTypeCode.description: Type code of the reservation control system/reference. PADIS 9893.

SpecialServiceListType.title: Air Special Service List Type
SpecialServiceListType.description: List of Special service types. Technical object only

PaxSegmentRefListType.title: Air Pax Segment Ref List Type
PaxSegmentRefListType.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID's - 1 or more pax segments references. These references will be to a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

FieldMetadataType.title: Air Field Metadata Type
FieldMetadataType.description: Defines implementation specific fields which should be populated.

mandatoryInd.description: When TRUE, indicates the associated field is expected to be populated.

pathText.description: Message property location using XPATH syntax.

ResChangeInfoType.title: Air Res Change Info Type
ResChangeInfoType.description: Reservation change information which describes new flight information as it relates to a changed reservation.

paxSegmentReferences.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID's - 1 or more pax segments references. These references will be to a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

resStatusCode.description: This field contains the Reservation Status Code of the 'Reservation Change' flight.

AddlNameType.title: Air Addl Name Type
AddlNameType.description: An additional name type. The structure consists of a generic proper name with associated type. Examples: Name - 'Smith'. Name Type Code - 'Fathers Surname'. Name - 'Park'. Name Type Code - 'Mothers Surname'.

name.description: A proper name defined by the associated name type code and further clarified by the description text. Name - 'Smith'. Name Type Code - 'Father Surname'. Name - 'Park'. Name Type Code - 'Mother Surname'.

nameTypeCode.description: The type of proper name Examples: 'Father Surname'. 'Mother Surname'.

StationType.title: Air Station Type
StationType.description: Location or facility where air or surface transportation originates, stops and/or terminates, and where passengers and/or cargo can be taken on or off. Those of relevance to the airline industry are identified by an IATA Location Identifier (3 letter location identifier). There are also additional airports without an IATA identifier that may be used in disruption scenarios that will be identified by an ICAO 4 letter code (assigned to every registered airport, military or civil). Business Identifier Fields: - IATA Location Code

iataLocationCode.description: IATA 3-letter code defining the city or airport code.

stationName.description: Name of the station. E.g. George Bush Intercontinental Airport.

FoidType.title: Air Foid Type
FoidType.description: Form of identification. Typically used to identify that the passenger is who he says he is. This is the type of FOID as defined in AIRIMP (FF Number, Credit Card Number, etc.).

foidTypeCode.description: Form of identification type code used for booking/ticketing. Examples: PP (passport), CC (credit card), FF (frequent flyer), DL (drivers license)

MerchantAccountType.title: Air Merchant Account Type
MerchantAccountType.description: A person or company that sells goods or services. A merchant works with an Acquiring Bank to apply for and receive a Merchant Account (an account that allows the Merchant to accept Credit and debit cards). Whenever a customer purchases an item with a Credit or debit card, the Merchant submits the purchase Transaction information to its Acquiring Bank, which will then submit it through the card association network to the card holder's Issuing Bank. The Issuing Bank will approve or decline the charge, and bill the cardholder the amount due to the Merchant.

carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

country.description: A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

merchantID.description: identifier passed from the merchant (airline) to the PSP/Bank to identify themselves during the authorization transaction.

merchantName.description: name under which the merchant is registered within their PSP/Bank

DiffPriceAndFareDetailsType.title: Air Diff Price And Fare Details Type
DiffPriceAndFareDetailsType.description: A specialization of a container for Price and Fare detail information.

fareDetail.description: The amount charged by the carrier for the carriage of a passenger and his allowable free baggage.

price.description: A specialization of price used for price differentials. Price is the amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

PenaltyInfoPriceType.title: Air Penalty Info Price Type
PenaltyInfoPriceType.description: This is a specialization of price when associated with a Penalty Info. Definition is: The Amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

curConversion.description: The result of converting one currency into another currency. E.g. local currency to USD, air miles to monetary.

equivAmount.description: The entire amount of transaction stated in the local currency at the point of sale, or the currency as defined by the Currency Indicator Code.

loyaltyUnitAmount.description: Amount specified in loyalty units. Note: the 'Currency Code' sup for this BDT should not be populated.

loyaltyUnitName.description: The name of the loyalty unit used by the loyalty unit amount (e.g. miles or points).

totalAmount.description: Total monetary price amount, including all tax, surcharge, and fee amounts.

baggageAllowanceRefID.description: Reference to a Bag Allowance ID within this message. If there are multiple Allowance ID's, then this should be treated as choice and one baggage item as defined in the referred baggage allowance element can be selected.

DistributionChainType.title: Air Distribution Chain Type
DistributionChainType.description: An instance of a distribution channel, which is a chain of intermediaries through which a good or service passes until it reaches the final buyer or the end consumer.

distributionChainLink.description: An organization playing a participating role in an instance of a distribution channel.

SecureProgramType.title: Air Secure Program Type
SecureProgramType.description: Contains enrolment information of the Payment Card. e.g. Verified by Visa.

enrollmentStatusText.description: 3D Secure Program Enrollment Status. Examples: CardNotEnrolled, CardEnrolled, CardMayBeEnrolled, Unknown

securePaymentProgramName.description: Name of the secure payment program. E.g. Verified by Visa.

TaxonomyFeatureType.title: Air Taxonomy Feature Type
TaxonomyFeatureType.description: Bilaterally agreed mechanism to describe specific product and service information to the Seller as defined by the Airline. This defines a further level of definition for a airline taxonomy code. e.g meal (TC 03F0) -> breakfast(03F1) - eggs(03F2),toast(03F3)

codesetCode.description: Defines the codeset code that is being used in each entry related to the specified codeset defined.

codesetNameCode.description: Defines the codeset that is being used in each entry to define the codeset code and the associated value text.

valueText.description: The textural description associated to the codeset code for a given defined codeset.

PieceAllowanceType.title: Air Piece Allowance Type
PieceAllowanceType.description: Defines the maximum number of each allowable baggage type.

totalQty.description: Maximum pieces of baggage allowed. Example: 4

ServiceDefinitionAssociationType.title: Air Service Definition Association Type
ServiceDefinitionAssociationType.description: Service Definition Association Choice to determine if the information of this ServiceDefinition needs to be extended with specific Bag or Seat characteristics or whether the ServiceDefinition is used as a bundle of further ServiceDefinitions.

seatProfileRef.description: Temp ABIE to Reference a Seat Profile Reference.

serviceBundle.description: A set of services offered for sale as a single service.

FiledFeeType.title: Air Filed Fee Type
FiledFeeType.description: Filed fee information relating to a coupon, including the Bankers Seller Rate used to convert the filed amount into the currency of payment.

bankersSellerRate.description: The BSR or BBR used to convert the filed fee amount from the filed currency into the currency of payment.

SalesTaxRegistrationType.title: Air Sales Tax Registration Type
SalesTaxRegistrationType.description: The Identification and contact information of a party purchasing goods or services as registered with a Purchase Tax.

cityName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the city, town or village.

countryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

countryDialingCode.description: Numeric telephone dialing prefixes for the member countries of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU). Note: The phone number can be put unstructured into the phone element or can be put structured into country dialing code, area code, phone number and extension.

countrySubDivisionName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the sub-division of a country.

emailAddressText.description: The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number text. Examples: +1 999-999-9999 ext 1234, 617-9976 Note: This may be a simple, un-structured phone number, such as +01 999-999-9999 ext 1234 or combined with the additional attributes to create a structured phone number.

salesTaxRegistrationID.description: Registered identifier of the business purchasing the goods and services. For example, a GST number in India XX.

streetText.description: Street name and number. Examples: Main Street, 100 Main Street

BinaryObjectType.title: Air Binary Object Type
BinaryObjectType.description: A binary object is a sequence of binary digits (bits).

encodingCode.description: Specifies the decoding algorithm of the binary object.

fileName.description: The filename of the binary object.

format.description: The format of the binary content.

uniformResourceID.description: The Uniform Resource Identifier that identifies where the Binary Object is located.

characterSetCode.description: The character set of the binary object if the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type is text.

mimeCode.description: The Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) media type of the binary object.

SurchargeType.title: Air Surcharge Type
SurchargeType.description: Amount added on to a usual charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

allRefundableInd.description: DEPRECATED - This element is deprecated as of 24.1 and will be decommissioned in a future release. Please consult implementation guidance on alternatives to this element. When true, all tax breakdown amounts are refundable.

breakdown.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

ResponseParametersResponseType.title: Air Response Parameters Response Type
ResponseParametersResponseType.description: A set of Information related to how response results should be returned.

bdc.description: A carrier whose baggage allowances and charges apply.

curParameter.description: Currency related parameters intended to influence which currency the shopping results are displayed in.

device.description: Device upon which the secure transaction will occur.

marketingMessage.description: Marketing message: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

measurementSystemCode.description: Measurement system code. Examples: Imperial, Metric

paxGroup.description: A number of individual passengers traveling under one commercial name that associates them. E.g. a Tour group or a group for sales allotment from airline to agency. Group bookings are subject to special booking rules and may be eligible for special fare rules. Usage and nature of groups is left to bilateral agreements.

pricingParameter.description: Pricing Parameters, including Simple Pricing, Award Travel, Auto Exchange, Override Currency and Tax Exemption.

reasonCode.description: Should be used for the Seller to communicate the reason for cancellation to the Seller (and for the Airline to respond with advice on the cancellation request. Uses PADIS REA Codeset.

paxSegmentRef.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID . This will be a reference to a single passenger segment that will be defined in a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

seatOnLeg.description: A sitting place for a passenger or crew in a cabin compartment on a Dated Operating Leg. Business Identifier Fields: - [Dated Operating Leg] (all identifier fields) - [Seat] (all identifier fields)

serviceDefinitionRef.description: Airline specific definition of a product or service (excluding flights) that can be separately sold and delivered. e.g. bag, seat, meal on a flight

LoyaltyProgramType.title: Air Loyalty Program Type
LoyaltyProgramType.description: A rewards program offered by a company to customers who frequently make purchases, which may give a customer advanced access to new products, special sales coupons or free merchandise.

alliance.description: Two or more airlines participating in a commercial relationship or joint venture, where a joint and commonly identifiable product is marketed under a single commercial name or brand.

carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

programName.description: Loyalty Program Name. Example: Miles and More

providerName.description: Name of the organization providing the Loyalty Program.

PayerType.title: Air Payer Type
PayerType.description: Party committing to pay. In the case of a Credit or Debit Card this would be the Cardholder.

payerEmailAddress.description: The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

payerPhoneNumber.description: A telephone number is a sequence of digits assigned to a fixed-line telephone subscriber station connected to a telephone line or to a wireless electronic telephony device, such as a radio telephone or a mobile telephone, or to other devices for data transmission via the public switched telephone network (PSTN) or other private networks.

paymentAddress.description: A physical address that is associated with payment types , This comprises of a postal address and optional payment verification.

ClearanceCarrierType.title: Air Clearance Carrier Type
ClearanceCarrierType.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc

airlineAccountingCode.description: IATA assigned numerical code of three digits only. Used to identify airlines for the purpose of financial reporting and settlement.

airlineDesigCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

CabinTypeType.title: Air Cabin Type Type
CabinTypeType.description: Type of compartment of an aircraft, offering specific services (e.g. business class, economy). Business Identifier Fields: - Cabin Type Code

cabinTypeCode.description: Cabin Type Code as defined by ATSB codeset 9873.

cabinTypeName.description: Name given to a cabin compartment (e.g. Business, First, Economy).

ReportingTypeCodeType.title: Air Reporting Type Code Content Type
ReportingTypeCodeType.description: Enum values for Reporting Type Code BDT. {codeListAgencyName}IATA AIDM{/codeListAgencyName}

seatChangeSupported.description: Seat changes are allowed on this booking.

cancelNotSupported.description: Cancel on this order is Not Supported. Default is Empty or False means cancel is supported on the API.

status.description: Indicates the internal status of the order.

ClearanceOrgType.title: Air Clearance Org Type
ClearanceOrgType.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

RefundLevelTypeCodeType.title: Air Refund Level Type Code Content Type
RefundLevelTypeCodeType.description: Contains the levels of re fundability FULL. PARTIAL. NONE. {codeListAgencyName}IATA AIDM{/codeListAgencyName}

ClearancePayerDataType.title: Air Clearance Payer Data Type
ClearancePayerDataType.description: Data defining the Clearance Payer and relevant to its operations.

clearancePayer.description: The party paying funds to clear claims against itself

clearancePayerReconciliationID.description: Identifier provided by the Clearance Payer to support internal financial processes, for example reconciliation. If this identifier is included in the clearance request then it must be included in all messages thereafter where it is provided as an option.

IdentityDocType.title: Air Identity Doc Type
IdentityDocType.description: Any document which may be used to identify a person or verify aspects of a person's personal identity. If issued in a small, standard credit card size form, it is usually called an identity card. Some countries issue formal identity documents, while others may require identity verification using informal documents. When the identity document incorporates a person's photograph, it may be called photo ID. In the absence of a formal identity document, a driver's license may be accepted in many countries for identity verification. Most countries accept passports as a form of identification.

addlName.description: An additional name type. The structure consists of a generic proper name with associated type. Examples: Name - 'Smith'. Name Type Code - 'Fathers Surname'. Name - 'Park'. Name Type Code - 'Mothers Surname'.

birthdate.description: Holder's date of birth as written on the document.

birthplaceText.description: Holder's birth location (e.g. city and/or country) as written on the document.

citizenshipCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

expiryDate.description: The date the identity document expires.

genderCode.description: Gender of the individual. Refer to PADIS Codeset 6353.

givenName.description: Holder's first or given name, as written on the document. E.g. JOHN.

identityDocTypeCode.description: The type of passenger document. Examples: PT (Passport)

issueDate.description: The date the identity document was issued.

issuingCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

middleName.description: Holder's middle name or initial, as written on the document. E.g. G, GEORGE.

residenceCountryCode.description: ISO Country Code (can be extended by bilateral agreement in case of exceptions, e.g. Kosovo). Examples: US, FR.

suffixName.description: Holder's name suffixes and letters, as written on the document. E.g. Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.

surname.description: Holder's family name or last name, as written on the document. E.g. SMITH. Excludes any potential suffix.

titleName.description: Holder's title as written on the document. E.g. Mr., Mrs., Miss, Dr.

PenaltyType.title: Air Penalty Type
PenaltyType.description: Information related to a punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.

netInd.description: The airline informs the seller if the penalty is netted (True) (i.e. taken from any amount that airline will owe to customer consequently to the servicing) or to be paid (False) (i.e. charged to customer upfront any servicing action, and even if customer benefits from a subsequent refund/ residual value).

penaltyID.description: Unique identifier of this Penalty instance.

price.description: This is a specialization of price when associated with a Penalty Base definition is: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

typeCode.description: Penalty type information. Examples: Cancellation, Change, NoShow, Upgrade, Other

OrderServiceDefinitionRefType.title: Air Order Service Definition Ref Type
OrderServiceDefinitionRefType.description: Airline specific definition of a product or service (excluding flights) that can be separately sold and delivered. e.g. bag, seat, meal on a flight

orderFlightAssociations.description: Order Service Definition Ref Flight Associations

serviceDefinitionRefID.description: References a Service Definition ID within this message.

IataEasyPayEncryptedDataType.title: Air Iata Easy Pay Encrypted Data Type
IataEasyPayEncryptedDataType.description: container for the encrypted Easy Pay data

ClearanceTravelAgencyType.title: Air Clearance Travel Agency Type
ClearanceTravelAgencyType.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

DistributionChainLinkType.title: Air Distribution Chain Link Type
DistributionChainLinkType.description: An organization playing a participating role in an instance of a distribution channel.

contactInfo.description: The electronic or geographic address which a party has provided as the contact channel. For example, contact email, contact postal address, contact phone number.

ordinal.description: The number defining the position of the distribution chain link in the distribution chain indicating the order in which the organization participated.

orgRole.description: The distribution chain role performed by the participating organization. That is, the Seller (end buyer facing), the Distributor (an intermediary), or the Carrier (the Responsible Supplier). For clarity this is different to the business model used by the participating organization, and the Nature of Business typically registered during incorporation as one of the organization's business activities.

participatingOrg.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

salesAgent.description: An individual conducting sales activities on behalf of a sales branch or organization.

salesBranch.description: An organizational unit with responsibility over sales in a market, for a product or service and under any other specified criteria.

verifiablePresentation.description: The root mode of the IATA Verifiable Presentation schema structure based on w3c Verifiable Credential Schema

TaxTypeCodeType.title: Air Tax Type Code Content Type

penalty.description: Information related to a punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.

OrderedOrderItemType.title: Air Ordered Order Item Type
OrderedOrderItemType.description: An Ordered individually priced item within an Ordered Order, made up of one or more Services. May or may not be a selected Offer Item (e.g. non-chargeable Services available on request such as a wheelchair).

airlineTaxonomy.description: Used in the context of the Airline Taxonomy to define a product or service to the seller or to request a collection of products and services from an airline. For more information on what values should be placed within these fields, see the implementation guide at: https://guides.developer.iata.org

bilateralTimeLimit.description: A bilaterally agreed limitation or restriction of time.
