cancelRestrictions.description: These are a set of qualifying conditions/rules/restrictions that are related to a constrained priced grouping of services for the Cancellation action.

changeRestrictions.description: These are a set of qualifying conditions/rules/restriction that are related to a constrained priced grouping of services for a Change/modification action.

commission.description: An amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.

depositTimeLimitDateTime.description: The date by which a deposit must be paid for an order item. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

existingOrderItemID.description: Reference to the previous order item id that was exchanged. Carrier assigned ID which exists uniquely within an Order.

fareDetail.description: The amount charged by the carrier for the carriage of a passenger and his allowable free baggage.

grandTotalAmount.description: Reflects the Differential Total Amount and the Penalty Total Amount, if netted.

namingTimeLimitDateTime.description: The time by which an Order Item must be completed with individual passenger names. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

netInd.description: The airline informs the seller if the penalty is netted (True) (i.e. taken from any amount that airline will owe to customer consequently to the servicing) or to be paid (False) (i.e. charged to customer upfront any servicing action, and even if customer benefits from a subsequent refund/ residual value).

orderItemID.description: Carrier assigned ID which exists uniquely within an Order.

ownerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

paymentTimeLimitDateTime.description: The time limit by which a commitment to pay must be made for the given Order Item. Upon expiry it is expected that the Order item is removed from the Order. If no value is returned, then no advice has been given. For example: PaymentTimeLimitDateTime: 2015-01-01T12:53:12Z - indicates the date time by which payment commitment is required.

price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

priceDifferential.description: For each OfferItem, this function allows the airline to inform the seller about amount differential type if this OfferItem is chosen.

priceGuaranteeTimeLimitDateTime.description: The length of time the price of an Order Item is guaranteed. In the absence of the price guarantee time limit, the price is not guaranteed. Upon expiry, the price may no longer be guaranteed and either the Order should be repriced, which may result in a new RepricedOffer, or a new shopping process may begin.

reusableInd.description: If Reusable = true, indicates that part of the value of the OrderItem may be reused for reshopping or refund. Exact reusable amount is unknown until Seller requests to reshop or to process a refund for this OrderItem.

richMedia.description: An external resource such as an Image, Video, PDF or other which is available for display

sellerFollowUpAction.description: A seller followup action following involuntary change means a subsequent action required to an Order Item after a schedule change.

service.description: Ordered Service specialization of an instance of a specific flight or Service Definition as it has been offered (and eventually ordered and consumed) in the context of a specific Offer and/or Order. At the time of shopping, a service can be sold to multiple passengers on a given journey. At time of order, the services should be applied to a single passenger on a single segment.

statusCode.description: Status of the Order Item Status instance. See ATSB Codeset OrderItem for possible values.

webAddressURI.description: Deep linking into another site to complete the transaction. E.g. to bring the customer directly to a page to continue with a purchase of a specific offer.

validatingCarrierCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

RateType.title: Air Rate Type
RateType.description: A rate is a quantity, amount, frequency, or dimensionless factor, measured against an independent base unit, expressed as a quotient.

baseMultiplierValue.description: The multiplier of the Rate. Base Unit, Code or Rate. Base Currency. Code

baseUnitCode.description: The unit of measure of the denominator

unitCode.description: The unit of measure of the numerator

format.description: Whether the number is an integer, decimal, real number or percentage

multiplierValue.description: The multiplier of the Rate. Unit. Code or Rate. Currency. Code

ChangeTypeCodeType.title: Air Change Type Code Content Type
ChangeTypeCodeType.description: Contains list of types of changes allowed Name, Flight Services

CountrySubDivisionType.title: Air Country Sub Division Type
CountrySubDivisionType.description: An area of land which is a sub-division within a country, such as a state, a county, a canton, a province, etc.

countrySubDivisionCode.description: ISO code 3166-2 identifying this country sub-division within a given country. E.g. 'US-AZ' for state of Arizona (United States of America), 'DE-BY' for region of Bavaria (Germany).

countrySubDivisionName.description: The name, expressed as text, of the sub-division of a country.

DatedOperatingLegListType.title: Air Dated Operating Leg List Type
DatedOperatingLegListType.description: A list of dated operating legs used in the contained message.

datedOperatingLeg.description: The nonstop operation of a transport vehicle between the departure station and the arrival station. Can be used for aircrafts as well as other transport vehicles such as train or bus etc.

SellerFollowUpActionType.title: Air Seller Follow Up Action Type
SellerFollowUpActionType.description: A seller followup action following involuntary change means a subsequent action required to an Order Item after a schedule change.

actionCode.description: Seller FollowUpAction used across Enhanced and Simplified Distribution Standards is defined in IATA codeset SellerFollowUpAction category.

actionInd.description: Action indicator at Order Item level with the following possible value. A 'true' value is returned when the follow-up action has not been completed. Absense of the indicator (or blank) means that there is no pending action.

actionTimeLimitDateTime.description: Point in date and time until the seller is allowed to take any FollowUpAction regarding an Order Item after a schedule change.

consequenceOfInactionCode.description: Impact of not taking any action by the seller after a schedule change by the airline. Possible values: o Auto-acceptance by airline o Auto-cancellation by airline

ClearancePayerType.title: Air Clearance Payer Type
ClearancePayerType.description: The party paying funds to clear claims against itself

carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc

org.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

travelAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

BookingRefType.title: Air Booking Ref Type
BookingRefType.description: Information related to a booking or reservation.

bookingEntity.description: Booking entity Information related to a booking or reservation.

bookingRefTypeCode.description: Booking Reference Type. Example: 6 (Passenger confirmation number) Encoding Scheme: IATA Padis Codeset - List for data element [1153] Reference Qualifier

codesetName.description: Name of the codeset (e.g. PADIS Codeset)

ownerName.description: Owner Entity Name. Ex: British Airways

ServiceBundleType.title: Air Service Bundle Type
ServiceBundleType.description: A set of services offered for sale as a single service.

maximumServiceQty.description: The maximum number of service definitions that may be selected from those in the bundle.

serviceDefinitionRefID.description: Airline specific definition of a product or service (excluding flights) that can be separately sold and delivered. e.g. bag, seat, meal on a flight

cabinTypeList.description: List of Cabin Types Technical object only

specialServiceList.description: List of Special service types. Technical object only

allRefundableInd.description: DEPRECATED - This element is deprecated as of 24.1 and will be decommissioned in a future release. Please consult implementation guidance on alternatives to this element. When true, all tax breakdown amounts are refundable.

approximateInd.description: When true, this tax is approximate.

collectionInd.description: When true, all specified tax breakdowns must be collected.

guaranteeTimeLimitDateTime.description: The length of time the Tax of an offer item is guaranteed. In the absence of the Tax guarantee time limit, the Tax is not guaranteed. Upon expiry, the Tax may no longer be guaranteed and either a new shopping process should begin, or the offer should be repriced resulting in a new Offer. Should the Tax guarantee time limit extend beyond Order creation, the remaining length of time persists into the corresponding Order Item. The airline can increase the remaining length of time beyond the original time limit should they wish to. This field should only be used when the Airline indicates that a Price Guarantee is available.

refundMethodText.description: Information from the Airline detailing to the Customer how the tax refund will be processed and what the Customer has to do for the refund.

tax.description: A compulsory contribution to state revenue, levied by the government on workers' income and business profits or added to the cost of some goods, services, and transactions.

totalRefundableTaxAmount.description: The total amount of all refundable taxes as calculated by the Airline.

totalTaxAmount.description: Total of all applicable tax amounts included in the price. If tax breakdowns are provided, this amount should match the sum of the tax breakdown amounts.

OrgType.title: Air Org Type
OrgType.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

contactInfo.description: The electronic or geographic address which a party has provided as the contact channel. For example, contact email, contact postal address, contact phone number.

RoundingPrecisionCodeType.title: Air Rounding Precision Code Content Type
RoundingPrecisionCodeType.description: An enum to specify if the rounding precision should be rounded up or down.

PaymentAddressType.title: Air Payment Address Type
PaymentAddressType.description: A physical address that is associated with payment types , This comprises of a postal address and optional payment verification.

paymentAddressVerification.description: Secure Payment-related Processing information, including AVS/ CVV Verification Results and Secure Payment Processing Results.

postalAddress.description: Natural or physical address used for postal service. May be a building address, airport address, etc.

PriceDifferentialType.title: Air Price Differential Type
PriceDifferentialType.description: For each OfferItem, this function allows the airline to inform the seller about amount differential type if this OfferItem is chosen.

differentialTypeCode.description: Several types of action are possible when the customer selects a reshopped offer-

diffPrice.description: A specialization of a container for Price and Fare detail information.

newPrice.description: A container for Price and Fare detail information.

oldPrice.description: A container for Price and Fare detail information.

OwnershipTypeCodeType.title: Air Ownership Type Code Content Type

PayerIndividualType.title: Air Payer Individual Type
PayerIndividualType.description: A Payer individual is a specialisation of the individual type defined as: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

birthplaceText.description: Country Code where the Passenger was born (ISO 3166). For example: DE

givenName.description: A personal name given to the individual at birth and used before a family name. Also called first name. E.g. JOHN.

individualID.description: Uniquely Identifies an Individual within the context of one message.

middleName.description: Individual's middle name or initial. E.g. G, GEORGE.

suffixName.description: Individual's name suffixes and letters. Examples: Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.

surname.description: Individual's hereditary name(s) common to all members of a family. Also known as family name or last name. E.g. SMITH. Excludes any potential suffix.

titleName.description: A word such as Mr., Mrs., Miss or Dr that is used before an individual's name to indicate the gender, profession or marital status.

CurAppCodeType.title: Air Cur App Code Content Type

PenaltyTypeCodeType.title: Air Penalty Type Code Content Type
PenaltyTypeCodeType.description: Enumeration set values for Penalty Type. {codeListAgencyName}IATA AIDM{/codeListAgencyName}

CouponType.title: Air Coupon Type
CouponType.description: The portion of the Passenger Ticket and Baggage Check or Excess Baggage Ticket that indicates particular places between which the coupon is good for carriage.

connectedCouponNumber.description: The coupon number to which this document is connected.

consumedAtIssuanceInd.description: When TRUE, the coupon is consumed at issuance.

couponMediaTypeCode.description: Type of media used to issue the coupon (e.g. Electronic, Paper, Other).

couponNumber.description: Number assigned to the issued coupon.

couponRefNumber.description: The sequential number (segment identifier) of an individual flight segment.

couponSeqNumber.description: The number representing the order in which this coupon was used or is to be used.

couponStatusCode.description: Current status of the flight/ value coupon. Example: E (Exchanged/Reissued)

couponValidityPeriod.description: Date range a coupon is valid for with an optional time component.

currentCouponFlightInfoRef.description: Current Coupon Flight Information Latest flight information as it relates to a coupon eg Current CheckedIn Flown.

excessBaggage.description: Excess baggage information displayed on a coupon.

fareBasisCode.description: Fare basis code as ticketed. Example: Y26

filedFee.description: Filed fee information relating to a coupon, including the Bankers Seller Rate used to convert the filed amount into the currency of payment.

involIndCode.description: Involuntary charge transaction code. Example: I (Involuntary - no reason given).

nonCommissionableInd.description: When TRUE, the document is non-commissionable.

nonInterlineableInd.description: When TRUE, the document is non-interlineable.

nonRefundableInd.description: When TRUE, the fare is non refundable.

nonReissuableNonExchInd.description: When TRUE, the document is non-reissuable and/or exchangeable.

productCharacteristic.description: Contextual information to further describe something using a key-value pair.

promotionRefID.description: Promotion code ID or number. Example: PROMO123. Used in conjunction with Link (Promotion URL), Issuer (Promotion Owner or Sponsor) and Remarks (Promotion remarks).

remarkText.description: Free text to provide further information related to the document and/or coupon.

resChangeInfo.description: Reservation change information which describes new flight information as it relates to a changed reservation.

rfic.description: Reason For Issuance Code Examples: A (Air Transportation) C (Baggage) E (Airport Services) F (Merchandise) G (In-flight Services)

rfisc.description: Reason For Issuance Sub Code. Examples: 0CC (First Checked Bag) 0B1 (In-flight Entertainment) 0BX (Lounge)

rfiscDesc.description: Corresponding description for the Reason for Issuance subcode.

serviceDeliveryDate.description: The date that the associated service to this Coupon should be delivered.

serviceDeliveryProviderLocationCode.description: The name of the service provider who will perform the service as described on an EMD coupon.

serviceDeliveryProviderName.description: The name of the service provider who will perform the service as described on an EMD coupon.

serviceQty.description: Number of services of the same type that are included in an EMD coupon.

settlementAuthorizationID.description: A reference ID generated by the validating carrier authorizing settlement of a coupon. Example: AUTH123

soldAirlineInfo.description: Reference to a PaxSegmentID's - 1 or more pax segments references. These references will be to a data list or pax segment list in the contained message.

valueAmount.description: The value associated to a single coupon of a miscellaneous document (e.g. 100 USD).

SeatProfileRefType.title: Air Seat Profile Ref Type
SeatProfileRefType.description: Temp ABIE to Reference a Seat Profile Reference.

seatProfileRefID.description: Reference to a Seat Profile ID within this message.

SecurePaymentVersion1Type.title: Air Secure Payment Version1 Type
SecurePaymentVersion1Type.description: Contains the indicators and fields that convey the result of the 3D Secure authentication transaction. Applicable for 3D Secure Version V 1.0.

payerAuthenticationResponseText.description: The authentication response for the 3-D Secure transaction. It is used to determine whether or not the customer has been authenticated by the card issuer. It must be included in the final authorization request. Example: eJzVWFmzosgSfudXdPQ8Gt1sbkzYRhQ7KCjI/sYOsimgoL/+lp7Tp5c5t2d67tMw8yv/WqiluJXS8WyyVFEQT28qz

PaymentProcessingSummaryType.title: Air Payment Processing Summary Type
PaymentProcessingSummaryType.description: Information relating to a payment transaction including payment status.

amount.description: The amount applied to the associated payment method. Example: 300 USD

clearanceData.description: set of data, either signed or not, that delivers all that is necessary for a clearance of funds to take place when using the SwO Standard and Process. It supplies the data needed to execute the clearance using the SwO Standard and Process. It is the core data required by the Clearance Manager to process a Clearance. Optionally, it can be agreed by the Clearance Payer and the Clearance Payee of the clearance

contactInfoRefID.description: Reference to the Payer's Contact ID within this message.

desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

payer.description: Party committing to pay. In the case of a Credit or Debit Card this would be the Cardholder.

paymentCommitmentDateTime.description: The date when the Payment including information about amount and payment method is accepted by ORA to be enough to lead to successful payment.

paymentID.description: Uniquely identifies payment information within a message.

paymentProcessingSummaryPaymentMethod.description: Payment Processing Summary Payment Method is a form of procedure for the payment of goods or services plus any transactional information specific to the payment method other than the amount.

paymentRefID.description: If creating the order after payment authorization it is a way of linking an order to an existing payment reference. not triggering the whole process again.

paymentStatusCode.description: Indicates the current status of this payment information.

paymentTrx.description: Additional identification and URLs used to further describe a secure payment transaction.

priceVarianceAmount.description: Price variance amount applied during Payment processing.

promotion.description: A Promotion and discount code criteria to be passed to the retailer airline that could influence returned offers.

surchargeAmount.description: Amount added to the final Offer/Order price, depending on which payment method is used by the client.

verificationInd.description: When true, this payment requires additional authentication.

SettlementInfoType.title: Air Settlement Info Type
SettlementInfoType.description: Information related to the value of a product or service as it pertains to interline transactions.

commission.description: An amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.

fee.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

methodCode.description: Settlement method. Examples: - AD (Internal Airline Document). - DS (Direct Settlement). - EA (EMD Associated or Internal Airline Document).

settlementAmount.description: Settlement (Price) Value. Example: 300 (USD) Note: This represents a Settlement value that is only used between the POA and ORA.

surcharge.description: Amount added on to a usual charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

tax.description: A compulsory contribution to state revenue, levied by the government on workers' income and business profits or added to the cost of some goods, services, and transactions.

taxableInd.description: In some markets, commission is VAT-able (i.e. Taxable)

PaymentOtherMethodAddlInfoType.title: Air Payment Other Method Addl Info Type
PaymentOtherMethodAddlInfoType.description: Additional Information for other payment criteria. For use with PaymentTypeCode(s) relating to Other forms of payment

KeyValuePropertyType.title: Air Key Value Property Type
KeyValuePropertyType.description: Contextual information to further describe something using a key-value pair.

keyText.description: Name or ID of the Keyword.

prefLevel.description: Information supporting a preference including preference level code (Examples: Preferred, Required or Exclude.).

valueText.description: Value corresponding to the associated Keyword.

SecurePaymentAuthenticationInstructionsV.title: Air Secure Payment Authentication Instructions Version2 Type
SecurePaymentAuthenticationInstructionsV.description: Data returned from the Directory Server/ACS containing the PAReq and the ACS URL that enable the cardholder to authenticate. Applicable for 3D-Secure. Applicable for 3D Secure Version V 2.0.

challengeMandateInd.description: Airline specify whether or not Seller should challenge 3D-Secure authentication.

merchantAccount.description: A person or company that sells goods or services. A merchant works with an Acquiring Bank to apply for and receive a Merchant Account (an account that allows the Merchant to accept Credit and debit cards). Whenever a customer purchases an item with a Credit or debit card, the Merchant submits the purchase Transaction information to its Acquiring Bank, which will then submit it through the card association network to the card holder's Issuing Bank. The Issuing Bank will approve or decline the charge, and bill the cardholder the amount due to the Merchant.

requestorURI.description: Fully qualified URL of 3DS Requestor web site or customer care site.

OtherAddressType.title: Air Other Address Type
OtherAddressType.description: Other Contact Method information. E.g. web site URL, social media handle.

contactTypeText.description: PADIS code list: Contact Type (to identify the technical contact type information)

otherAddressText.description: Other Contact Method Value. Example: www.marketingsite.com

CarrierType.title: Air Carrier Type
CarrierType.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

airlineDesigCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

duplicateDesigInd.description: Indicates that the IATA Airline Designator is a duplicate code shared by multiple airlines. To identify the airline - in this case - its name must be specified in addition to the designator.

signatureType.description: Payload information for this notification message.

PrefLevelType.title: Air Pref Level Type
PrefLevelType.description: Information supporting a preference including preference level code (Examples: Preferred, Required or Exclude.).

prefLevelCode.description: Level of preference requested. Examples: Preferred, Required or Exclude.

PaymentTrxChannelCodeType.title: Air Payment Trx Channel Code Content Type
PaymentTrxChannelCodeType.description: Lists types of payment transaction channels

OrderStructureKeyType.title: Air Order Structure Key Type
OrderStructureKeyType.description: A uniquely identified record of the agreement of one party with another to receive products and services under specified terms and conditions. Order supports the sale of a flexible range of airline products and services that are not necessarily Journey based (e.g. subscription services). Comment: A 'PNR', 'super PNR' and 'ticket' are all today's versions of airline implementations of aspects of an Order. An Order may support non-homogeneity, i.e. each passenger in an Order may hold different sets of order items at different prices.

orderID.description: Carrier assigned ID which uniquely identifies a specific Order across several messages.

orderItem.description: An Order key individually priced item within an Order key Order, made up of one or more Services. May or may not be a selected Offer Item (e.g. non-chargeable Services available on request such as a wheelchair).

orderVersionNumber.description: Version of the Order used to track the evolution of an Order and the changes made to it.

ownerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

PenaltyPriceType.title: Air Penalty Price Type
PenaltyPriceType.description: This is a specialization of price when associated with a Penalty Base definition is: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

totalAmount.description: Total monetary price amount, including all tax, surcharge, and fee amounts.

OrderPenaltyInfoType.title: Air Order Penalty Info Type
OrderPenaltyInfoType.description: Information related to a penalty applied to an OrderItem following a servicing operation.

orderItemRefID.description: Reference to an Order Item ID to which the penalty was first applied..

paxRefID.description: Reference to a Passenger ID to which the penalty has been applied.

penaltyDetails.description: Information related to a penalty applied to the requested servicing operations.

fieldMetadata.description: Defines implementation specific fields which should be populated.

GeneralAssociationType.title: Air General Association Type
GeneralAssociationType.description: List the object intended to be associated within this message.

associatedObjectID.description: Identifier of the object intended to be associated within this message. E.g. PAX001

associatedObjectName.description: Name of the object intended to be associated. E.g. Passenger

associatedObjectPath.description: XPath to the object intended to be associated within this message.

OriginalTicketIssuanceInfoType.title: Air Original Ticket Issuance Info Type
OriginalTicketIssuanceInfoType.description: An Original issuing carrier and issuing location and ticket number.

iataLocationCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

issueDate.description: The date that the document was originally issued.

issueTime.description: The time that the document was originally issued.

issuingCarrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

ticketNumber.description: The document number comprised of the airline code, form code, and serial number.

travelAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

ChangeRestrictionsType.title: Air Change Restrictions Type
ChangeRestrictionsType.description: These are a set of qualifying conditions/rules/restriction that are related to a constrained priced grouping of services for a Change/modification action.

allowedModificationInd.description: This flags if this condition allows any modification. If this is set to FALSE then the condition further identified by the other attributes indicates that no Change is allowed.

changeTypeCode.description: This identifies using Change type Code ENUM the type of change that applies to the condition. valid examples are NAME FLIGHT SERVICE

descText.description: Describes what this restriction is. E.G -Change allowed within dates(1) specified with associated fee. --Change allowed within dates(2) specified with associated fee. - No change allowed

effectiveDateTime.description: This identifies the effective date used in conjunction with the Expiration date to qualify the applicability of this condition This date is relative to the first flight segment.

expirationDateTime.description: This identifies the Expiration date used in conjunction with the Effective date to qualify the applicability of this condition This date is relative to the first flight segment.

fee.description: Amount added on to a charge for a specific product, purpose, or service.

journeyStageCode.description: Valid Stage Codes are defined in the Journey Stage Type Code ENUM PRIOR TO DEPARTURE NO SHOW AFTER DEPARTURE This will be used either in addition to other BBIE's or individually to qualify a condition.

paxRefID.description: Used to store a ref to the passenger.

refund.description: Contains refund type, payment type and amount attributes for a specific product, purpose, or service.

SettlementPlanType.title: Air Settlement Plan Type
SettlementPlanType.description: Any payment that is collected by the agent and settled between the Airline and the agent. Refer to IATA Resolution 728 Attachment A for full details.

paymentTypeCode.description: The payment method type. Examples: Credit Card, Cash.

transactionId.description: An Id to correlate the response to a request when the caller gets a callback..

DeviceType.title: Air Device Type
DeviceType.description: Device upon which the secure transaction will occur.

deviceCode.description: The device code from which the request was initiated. PADIS codeset TST.

presenceTypeCode.description: Specifies the Presence of a customer.

PaymentCardAddlInfoType.title: Air Payment Card Addl Info Type
PaymentCardAddlInfoType.description: Additional Information relating to Payment Cards. For use with PaymentTypeCode(s) relating to Card forms of payment

cardProductTypeCode.description: Used to specify whether the card is a Consumer (personal) or Commercial (corporate) card.

cardTypeText.description: Additional description for the magnetic stripe card type (debit card, credit card, prepaid card, etc.)

securePaymentAuthenticationVersion.description: Used by Seller if 3D-Secure is supported. Seller can specify which version of 3D-Secure is supported. Note: 3D-Secure context should be used when the Customer-Seller interaction type is web and/or mobile.

verificationInd.description: When 'true', this payment requires additional authentication.

PhoneType.title: Air Phone Type
PhoneType.description: A telephone number is a sequence of digits assigned to a fixed-line telephone subscriber station connected to a telephone line or to a wireless electronic telephony device, such as a radio telephone or a mobile telephone, or to other devices for data transmission via the public switched telephone network (PSTN) or other private networks.

areaCodeNumber.description: Phone number area code. Example: 813 Note: The phone number can be put unstructured into the phone element or can be put structured into country dialing code, area code, phone number and extension.

contactTypeText.description: PADIS code list: Contact Type (to identify the technical contact type information)

countryDialingCode.description: Numeric telephone dialing prefixes for the member countries of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU). Note: The phone number can be put unstructured into the phone element or can be put structured into country dialing code, area code, phone number and extension.

extensionNumber.description: Phone extension number. Example: 1234 Note: The phone number can be put unstructured into the phone element or can be put structured into country dialing code, area code, phone number and extension.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number text. Examples: +1 999-999-9999 ext 1234, 617-9976 Note: This may be a simple, un-structured phone number, such as +01 999-999-9999 ext 1234 or combined with additional attributes country dialing code, area code and extension to create a structured phone number.

SalesBranchType.title: Air Sales Branch Type
SalesBranchType.description: An organizational unit with responsibility over sales in a market, for a product or service and under any other specified criteria.

salesBranchID.description: The industry wide unique identifier of the sales branch. Commonly, a value from the Pseudo City Code may be used, or a bi-latterly agreed code. When the latter it must only be used between parties that hold an appropriate translation.

GenderCodeType.title: Air Gender Code Content Type
GenderCodeType.description: Enumeration set for Gender Code. {codeListAgencyName}ICAO{/codeListAgencyName} {codeListName}Document 9303 Sex of the holder{/codeListName}

IataAircraftTypeType.title: Air Iata Aircraft Type Type
IataAircraftTypeType.description: Grouping of aircrafts with the same form, function and specification, currently flown, or soon to be flown. Possible types are defined in the IATA SSIM. The same type may include aircrafts with different technical specifications such as engines, range, cockpit configuration. Business Identifier Fields: - IATA Aircraft Type Code

iataAircraftTypeCode.description: Code assigned to an aircraft type in IATA SSIM.

AllianceType.title: Air Alliance Type
AllianceType.description: Two or more airlines participating in a commercial relationship or joint venture, where a joint and commonly identifiable product is marketed under a single commercial name or brand.

allianceCode.description: Used to specify the alliance based on PADIS Code List (code list defined in BDT).

carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

name.description: Alliance name. Example: One World Alliance

OrderItemKeyType.title: Air Order Item Key Type
OrderItemKeyType.description: An Order key individually priced item within an Order key Order, made up of one or more Services. May or may not be a selected Offer Item (e.g. non-chargeable Services available on request such as a wheelchair).

orderItemRefID.description: Carrier assigned ID which exists uniquely within an Order.

ownerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

service.description: Service Key specialization of an instance of a specific flight or Service Definition as it has been offered (and eventually ordered and consumed) in the context of a specific Offer and/or Order. At the time of shopping, a service can be sold to multiple passengers on a given journey. At time of order, the services should be applied to a single passenger on a single segment.

PrefLevelCodeType.title: Air Pref Level Code Content Type
PrefLevelCodeType.description: Level of preference requested. Examples: Preferred, Required or Exclude

ContactInfoType.title: Air Contact Info Type
ContactInfoType.description: The electronic or geographic address which a party has provided as the contact channel. For example, contact email, contact postal address, contact phone number.

contactInfoID.description: Uniquely Identifies a set of Contact Information, within the context of one message.

contactPurposeText.description: to identify the contact purpose (PADIS code list 3299)

contactRefusedInd.description: When TRUE, Contact Information was refused to be provided.

emailAddress.description: The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

individual.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

otherAddress.description: Other Contact Method information. E.g. web site URL, social media handle.

paxSegmentRefID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger Segment within the context of one message.

phone.description: A telephone number is a sequence of digits assigned to a fixed-line telephone subscriber station connected to a telephone line or to a wireless electronic telephony device, such as a radio telephone or a mobile telephone, or to other devices for data transmission via the public switched telephone network (PSTN) or other private networks.

postalAddress.description: Natural or physical address used for postal service. May be a building address, airport address, etc.

relationshipToPax.description: Relationship to the passenger e.g. used for when this individual is an emergency contact

PaxJourneyType.title: Air Pax Journey Type
PaxJourneyType.description: A collection of segments which satisfies transportation of a passenger for a given origin and destination. Business Identifier Fields: - (no identifier available)

distanceMeasure.description: Total distance between the beginning and end stations of a leg, measured by the great circle of the earth.

duration.description: Total journey time including the combined air time and connection times. In case of stopover, this may or may not include stopover durations.

paxJourneyID.description: Uniquely identifies a Passenger Journey within the context of one message.

paxSegmentRefID.description: Reference to a Passenger Segment ID within this message.

settlementInfo.description: Information related to the value of a product or service as it pertains to interline transactions.

TicketIssuanceInfoType.title: Air Ticket Issuance Info Type
TicketIssuanceInfoType.description: The issuing carrier and issuing location of a ticket.

iataLocationCode.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station.

issueDate.description: The date that the document was originally issued.

issueTime.description: The time that the document was originally issued.

issuingCarrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

travelAgency.description: A private retailer or public service that provides travel and tourism related services to the public on behalf of suppliers such as activities, airlines, car rentals, cruise lines, hotels, railways, travel insurance, and package tours.

PaymentTrxType.title: Air Payment Trx Type
PaymentTrxType.description: Additional identification and URLs used to further describe a secure payment transaction.

descText.description: Transaction description information. Ex: Air Fare Two PAX

inputCurCode.description: Input Payment Currency code. Example: USD

maximumTryInd.description: When TRUE, the maximum payment authentication attempts have been exceeded.

notProcessedInd.description: When TRUE, the payment information has not been processed.

originalID.description: The identifier of the original transaction that initiated this Traveler authentication. Example: TRN12345

paymentAddressVerification.description: Secure Payment-related Processing information, including AVS/ CVV Verification Results and Secure Payment Processing Results.

retryInd.description: When TRUE, the payment transaction should be present.

settlementCurCode.description: Settlement Payment Currency code. Example: CHF

trxID.description: Globally unique ID for a transaction processing instance.

trxTypeText.description: 3D Secure Transaction Type. Examples: Authorize: Authorize amount (no funds transferred) Complete: Complete a previous authorization (funds are transferred) Purchase: Purchase (funds are transferred immediately) Refund: Refund (funds transferred immediately) Validate: Validation Transaction (a small authorized transaction amount to validate card details including expiry date and address)

PaymentAddressVerificationType.title: Air Payment Address Verification Type
PaymentAddressVerificationType.description: Secure Payment-related Processing information, including AVS/ CVV Verification Results and Secure Payment Processing Results.

addressVerificationInvalidInd.description: When true, the specified address was invalid.

addressVerificationNoMatchInd.description: When true, the specified address could not be matched with issuing bank address on record.

addressVerificationStatusCode.description: The address verification response code (AVS) when the ticketing agency performs address verification. Examples: X - Match: Street address and 9-digit ZIP code both match Y - Match: Street address and 5-digit ZIP code both match A - Partial Match: Street address matches, but both 5-digit and 9-digit ZIP Code do not match W - Partial Match: Street address does not match, but 9-digit ZIP code matches Z - Partial Match: Street address does not match, but 5-digit ZIP code matches N - No Match: Street address, 5-digit ZIP code, and 9-digit ZIP code all do not match U - System Unavailable: Address information unavailable. Returned if non-US. AVS is not available or if the AVS in a U.S. bank is not functioning properly. R - System Unavailable: Retry - Issuer's System Unavailable or Timed Out. E - Invalid: AVS data is invalid S - Not Supported: U.S. issuing bank does not support AVS

BaggageDisclosureType.title: Air Baggage Disclosure Type
BaggageDisclosureType.description: Disclosure information specifically related to baggage.

baggageDisclosureID.description: Uniquely identifies a Bag Disclosure within the message.

bdc.description: A carrier whose baggage allowances and charges apply.

checkInChargesInd.description: If TRUE, additional taxes, fees and charges may be collected at check-in (regionally determined).

commercialAgreementID.description: Bilateral agreement identifier E.g. baggage cost, Baggage Determining Carrier, etc.

deferralInd.description: If TRUE, The ORA advises the POA that the POA is given the Baggage Determining Carrier designation

desc.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

fixedPrePaidInd.description: Allows POA to tell the ORA if the ORA may alter the POA's pre-paid baggage charges. If TRUE, prepaid charge may NOT be altered If FALSE, prepaid charge MAY be altered

ruleTypeCode.description: US Department of Transportation (DOT) Reservation or Disclosure baggage rule. Examples: Y, Disclosure AND US DOT Reservation

EmployerType.title: Air Employer Type
EmployerType.description: An organized structure set up for a particular purpose, such as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.

salesTaxRegistration.description: The Identification and contact information of a party purchasing goods or services as registered with a Purchase Tax.

taxationExemptionQualifierCode.description: To store Tax exemption qualification status. e.g Organization is in/a SEZ (special economic zone) UN or PSU (Public Sector Undertakings)

taxDeductedAtSourceCapabilityInd.description: Identifies if the Organization has the capability to apply Tax Deduction at Source.

displayInd.description: When TRUE, this remark should be displayed. Notes: 1. This capability may not be supported by all NDC-enabled systems or may be supported by bilateral agreement only. The technical implementation of this capability is not dictated by this specification.

remarkText.description: Additional, supplementary information about the document or service.

ClearancePayeeDataType.title: Air Clearance Payee Data Type
ClearancePayeeDataType.description: Data defining the Clearance Payee and relevant to its operations.

clearancePayee.description: The party receiving funds as a result of a clearance for a claim it has made

clearancePayeeReconciliationID.description: identifier provided by the Clearance Payee to support internal financial processes, for example reconciliation. If this identifier is included in the clearance request then it must be included in all messages thereafter where it is provided as an option.

RbdType.title: Air Rbd Type
RbdType.description: Reservation Booking Designator. A categorization used to facilitate access to inventory, application of filed fares, and to identify cabin entitlement. Identified using a single alpha character. E.g. 'J' for Business Class Premium, 'D' for Business Discounted. There will typically be several RBDs defined for a given Cabin Type. Business Identifier Fields: - RBD Code

rbdCode.description: Code used to identify a particular RBD (e.g. P, J, W, M, etc.).

CardNumberCollectionCodeType.title: Air Card Number Collection Code Content Type
CardNumberCollectionCodeType.description: Lists type of collection for the Card Number K - Keyed in for this transaction S - Card on file (previously stored credentials)

ServiceKeyType.title: Air Service Key Type
ServiceKeyType.description: Service Key specialization of an instance of a specific flight or Service Definition as it has been offered (and eventually ordered and consumed) in the context of a specific Offer and/or Order. At the time of shopping, a service can be sold to multiple passengers on a given journey. At time of order, the services should be applied to a single passenger on a single segment.

bookingRef.description: Information related to a booking or reservation.

datedOperatingLegRef.description: Reference to a Dated Operating Leg within this message

serviceID.description: Uniquely Identifies a Service within the context of one message.

validatingCarrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

OrderPenaltyInfoListType.title: Air Order Penalty Info List Type

penaltyInfo.description: Information related to a penalty applied to an OrderItem following a servicing operation.

DatedOperatingLegRefType.title: Air Dated Operating Leg Ref Type
DatedOperatingLegRefType.description: Reference to a Dated Operating Leg within this message

datedOperatingLegRefID.description: Reference to the Dated Operating Legs.

SeatProfileType.title: Air Seat Profile Type
SeatProfileType.description: Airline defined group of seats sharing common characteristics.

marketingInfo.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

richMedia.description: An external resource such as an Image, Video, PDF or other which is available for display

seatCharacteristicCode.description: Characteristic of an aircraft seat e.g. A (Aisle seat), E (Exit and emergency exit),..., according to PADIS code list 9825.

seatKeywords.description: Contextual information to further describe something using a key-value pair.

seatPitchMeasure.description: Measure of a given seat's pitch.

seatProfileID.description: Unique identifier associated to this Seat Profile.

seatWidthMeasure.description: Measure of a given seat's width.

LegCabinAssociationsType.title: Air Leg Cabin Associations Type
LegCabinAssociationsType.description: A container to enable cabins to be associated with legs.

legsAssociatedCabin.description: An association of cabin types to 1 or more legs.

DistributionChainRoleCodeType.title: Air Concur Distribution Chain Role Code Content Type

seatProfile.description: Airline defined group of seats sharing common characteristics.

TicketType.title: Air Ticket Type
TicketType.description: The accountable document issued by or on behalf of a carrier which includes notices and the flight and passenger coupons contained therein.

connectedDocNumber.description: The ticket/ document number to which this document is connected.

coupon.description: The portion of the Passenger Ticket and Baggage Check or Excess Baggage Ticket that indicates particular places between which the coupon is good for carriage.

exchReissueInd.description: When TRUE, the specified ticket/document number is on behalf of a document which has been exchanged or reissued.

feeOwnerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

presentCreditCardInd.description: When TRUE, the credit/debit card used for purchase must be presented.

primaryDocInd.description: When TRUE, this is the primary ticket/document number.

remarkText.description: Free text to provide further information related to the document.

reportingTypeCode.description: For billing and settlement purposes, each time a travel agent requests an airline to perform an action on a document (Issuance, Refund, Exchange), he needs to know how to reconcile this action (via BSP, ARC, directly by ORA, etc.).

routingCode.description: For EMD-A and EMD-S tickets with routing. Use 'D' if all board and off points are within the same country and 'I' if all board and of points are not within the same country. For EMD-S with no routing, do not use.

taxOnEMDInd.description: When TRUE, a tax has been collected and is due to a local government from the validating carrier.

ticketDocTypeCode.description: Document type code as defined by PADIS 1001 (Document/ Message Name, coded).

ticketNumber.description: The document number comprised of the airline code, form code, and serial number.

DataListsType.title: Air Data Lists Type
DataListsType.description: Data List definition for this message.

datedMarketingSegmentList.description: A list of dated marketing segments used in the contained message.

datedOperatingLegList.description: A list of dated operating legs used in the contained message.

datedOperatingSegmentList.description: A list of dated operating segments used in the contained message.

MarkupType.title: Air Markup Type
MarkupType.description: Defines the reason for the markup added by an airline as part of the offer reported as calculation detail. The amount added to the cost price of goods to cover overhead and profit. [Oxford]

amount.description: Value and sold-in currency added by an airline as part of the offer reported as calculation detail.

typeCode.description: Defines the reason for the markup added by an airline as part of the offer reported as calculation detail. (Examples: currency markup, service markup, etc).

PaymentSurchargeType.title: Air Payment Surcharge Type
PaymentSurchargeType.description: Information about surcharges for payment methods.

amountRangeMaximumAmount.description: Maximum Amount of a Fee range of a payment method

amountRangeMinimumAmount.description: Minimum Amount of a Fee range of a payment method

percentageRangeMaximumPercent.description: Maximum Percentage value of a Fee range of a payment method

percentageRangeMinimumPercent.description: Minimum Percentage value of a Fee range of a payment method

preciseAmount.description: Maximum Amount of a Fee range of a payment method

precisePercent.description: Maximum Percentage value of a Fee range of a payment method

roundingNumberOfDecimalsNumber.description: Number of decimals of fee rounding

PresenceTypeCodeType.title: Air Presence Type Code Content Type

IndividualType.title: Air Individual Type
IndividualType.description: A single human being as distinct from a group, class, or family.

addlName.description: An additional name type. The structure consists of a generic proper name with associated type. Examples: Name - 'Smith'. Name Type Code - 'Fathers Surname'. Name - 'Park'. Name Type Code - 'Mothers Surname'.

birthdate.description: The date on which an individual was born.

birthplaceText.description: Country Code where the Passenger was born (ISO 3166). For example: DE

genderCode.description: Gender of the individual. Refer to PADIS Codeset 6353.

givenName.description: A personal name given to the individual at birth and used before a family name. Also called first name. E.g. JOHN.

individualID.description: Uniquely Identifies an Individual within the context of one message.

middleName.description: Individual's middle name or initial. E.g. G, GEORGE.

suffixName.description: Individual's name suffixes and letters. Examples: Jr., Sr., III, Ret., Esq.

surname.description: Individual's hereditary name(s) common to all members of a family. Also known as family name or last name. E.g. SMITH. Excludes any potential suffix.

titleName.description: A word such as Mr., Mrs., Miss or Dr that is used before an individual's name to indicate the gender, profession or marital status.

PenaltyDetailsType.title: Air Penalty Details Type
PenaltyDetailsType.description: Information related to a penalty applied to the requested servicing operations.

netInd.description: The airline informs the seller if the penalty is netted (True) (i.e. taken from any amount that airline will owe to customer consequently to the servicing) or to be paid (False) (i.e. charged to customer upfront any servicing action, and even if customer benefits from a subsequent refund/ residual value).

price.description: This is a specialization of price when associated with a Penalty Info. Definition is: The Amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

statusCode.description: Status of the Penalty details. See ATSB Codeset PenaltyStatus for possible values. Absence of element implies no information about the status of the penalty is available.

typeCode.description: Penalty type information. Examples: Cancellation, Change, NoShow, Upgrade, Other

PayerAuthenticationExemptionCodeType.title: Air Payer Authentication Exemption Code Content Type
PayerAuthenticationExemptionCodeType.description: Lists type of Payer Authentication Exemptions

CarrierFeeType.title: Air Carrier Fee Type
CarrierFeeType.description: Carrier imposed fee detail, typically related to booking, ticketing, or servicing.

appCode.description: Code used to specify if the fee is non-interlineable, non-refundable, or non-commissionable.

carrier.description: The organization which carries the passenger, baggage, or goods, and/or commits to delivering the carriage as well as any related services such as issuance of ticket, creation of Order, etc. Business Identifier Fields: - Airline Designator Code - Duplicate Designator Indicator - Name

fareComponent.description: A portion of an itinerary between two consecutive fare construction points. If the journey has only one fare component, the points of origin and destination are the only fare construction points

originDest.description: The Origin and Destination airport/city pair which confines a passenger journey or an aircraft flight. Business Identifier Fields: - [Station] (Origin Station) IATA Location Code - [Station] (Destination Station) IATA Location Code

paymentBrandCode.description: A Payment Brand code assigned according to ATS Codeset PAYB. Example VI for Visa

paymentTypeCode.description: A Payment Type code assigned according to ATS Codeset PAYT. For example: 'CC' for Customer Card.

reportingCodeText.description: A Reporting Code for related to booking, ticketing, or servicing.

TaxExemptionQualificationCodeType.title: Air Tax Exemption Qualification Code Content Type
TaxExemptionQualificationCodeType.description: Enumeration values for Tax exemption Qualification e.g SEZ (Special Economic Zone), UN , PSU (Public Sector Undertakings) {codeListAgencyName}IATA AIDM{/codeListAgencyName}

FarePriceTypeCodeType.title: Air Fare Price Type Code Content Type
FarePriceTypeCodeType.description: An enum of a fare price type defining the types of fare price allowed.

pax.description: Any person except members of the crew carried or to be carried with the consent of the carrier, on board of any transport vehicle such as aircraft, train, bus, ship. Holds the attributes specific to a one booking, from shopping to fulfillment.

ClearanceMethodsType.title: Air Clearance Methods Type
ClearanceMethodsType.description: These are the clearance options with their supporting information proposed by the carrier for a given offer. It supplies the methods available to clear a payment. It is part of the 'Payment Supported Method', and it is relevant whenever the method of payment will require clearance of funds between the partners of the sale. Includes the Commission data to allow the carrier to support choices that are in line with its payment policy.

commission.description: An amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.

netClearanceAmount.description: The funds to be cleared as a result of the payment commitment, the selected payment method, and the date when the funds must be remitted. It is the amount the Clearance Payer must pay to the Clearance Payee on a given Remittance Date taking into consideration any funds due to the Clearance Payer by the Clearance Payee as a result of the same payment commitment.

processRuleCode.description: defines under what governing rules, process and reporting standard the Clearance Manager processes the clearance. Example: IATAC00 or BLTRL00 or NDCLNK0

remittanceDate.description: The date when the amount in the clearance request that is paid by the Clearance Payer will have to reach the settlement manager's bank account

OrderedOrderType.title: Air Ordered Order Type
OrderedOrderType.description: A uniquely identified record of the agreement of one party with another to receive products and services under specified terms and conditions. Order supports the sale of a flexible range of airline products and services that are not necessarily Journey based (e.g. subscription services). Comment: A 'PNR', 'super PNR' and 'ticket' are all today's versions of airline implementations of aspects of an Order. An Order may support non-homogeneity, i.e. each passenger in an Order may hold different sets of order items at different prices.

bilateralTimeLimit.description: A bilaterally agreed limitation or restriction of time.

commission.description: An amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.

creationDateTime.description: The date time by which the order is created. Examples: 2018-09-05T15:52:01Z

depositTimeLimitDateTime.description: The date by which a deposit must be paid for an order Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date time by which the order is modified. Examples: 2018-09-05T15:52:01Z

namingTimeLimitDateTime.description: The time by which an Order must be completed with individual passenger names. Examples: 2015-01-13T13:59:38Z

orderID.description: Carrier assigned ID which uniquely identifies a specific Order across several messages.

orderItem.description: An Ordered individually priced item within an Ordered Order, made up of one or more Services. May or may not be a selected Offer Item (e.g. non-chargeable Services available on request such as a wheelchair).

orderVersionNumber.description: Version of the Order used to track the evolution of an Order and the changes made to it.

originalOrderID.description: Carrier assigned ID which uniquely identifies a specific Order across several messages.

ownerCode.description: Airline code assigned to a carrier. Either ICAO-defined 3-character code or IATA-defined 2-character code.

paxGroup.description: A number of individual passengers traveling under one commercial name that associates them. E.g. a Tour group or a group for sales allotment from airline to agency. Group bookings are subject to special booking rules and may be eligible for special fare rules. Usage and nature of groups is left to bilateral agreements.

richMedia.description: An external resource such as an Image, Video, PDF or other which is available for display

statusCode.description: Status of the Order Status instance. See ATSB Codeset OrderStatus for possible values.

totalPrice.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

webAddressURI.description: Deep linking into another site to complete the transaction. E.g. to bring the customer directly to a page to continue with a purchase of a specific offer.

DescType.title: Air Desc Type
DescType.description: An account or representation of the certain or major aspects, characteristics, or features of a person, object, or event.

markupStyleText.description: Mark-up Style of the Description Text. Example: HTML

LoyaltyProgramAccountType.title: Air Loyalty Program Account Type
LoyaltyProgramAccountType.description: An account set up for a customer within a rewards program which holds funds on behalf of that customer.

accountNumber.description: Loyalty Program account number. Example: ABC123456

loyaltyProgram.description: A rewards program offered by a company to customers who frequently make purchases, which may give a customer advanced access to new products, special sales coupons or free merchandise.

tierPriorityText.description: Loyalty Program account priority within the tier (e.g. Platinum, executive, etc.)

FarePriceTypeType.title: Air Fare Price Type Type
FarePriceTypeType.description: An additional specified fare pricing such as 'Net' and 'Filed'. For 'Sell' or public amounts, use the Price in Fare Details.

farePriceTypeCode.description: Indicates if the fare price provided is a filed amount, net amount, or a sell amount.

price.description: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.

EmailAddressType.title: Air Email Address Type
EmailAddressType.description: The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

contactTypeText.description: PADIS code list: Contact Type (to identify the technical contact type information)

emailAddressText.description: The email address which should be used for contact purposes.

priceClass.description: A price point within a particular Cabin Type (sometimes referred to as 'Fare Families').
